At this moment, I'd like to better stock my business and offer a larger variety of products to my customers. Most of them are school teachers and office workers. The better assorted by business is, the better the sales and income will be.

Translated by Raón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Danelia del Carmen, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de cosmeticos, lociones y enchape, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, considerando que la mayoria de mis clientes son maestros y empleados de oficina. considerando que entre mas surtido esta el negocio mayores son las ventas y por ende los ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of lotions, cosmetics, and fashion jewelry

loans.name: Sixto Hernandez

texts.es:
My name is Sixto Hernandez. My principal work is in commerce in a store located in the transport terminal of my city. I have several years of experience in dedicating myself to this type of work. It generates income for me to cover the expenses of my family and my commitments to suppliers. I have a very good clientele and the location of my business is strategic. For that reason, I need to supply a bit more to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Sicto Hernandez, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en la terminal de transporte de mi ciudad. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, tengo muy buena clientela ya que la ubicación de mi negocio es estrategica, por lo que necesito surtir un poco mas para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a los clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, rice, flour, toilet tissue, soap, sausages, cold meats, and other dairy products.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana is 59 years old, married, and has 4 children, all who are grown up. She's had a grocery store in her home for more than 30 years. She opened the store in her own house and had ups and downs in her business. In 1995, she had to shut down her store because of a economic crisis going on in her country. Thanks to her siblings' and husband's help, she was able to newly rebuild her store 4 years later. Following this line, she sells basic goods like fruits, vegetables, milk, flour, noodles, etc. Because of the store, she can contribute her earnings to her home.

There was a strong emigration and many of her customer left for Spain for better opportunities for work - Luciana was left worried. However, she continued to struggle and gave better attention to her new customers. She wishes to continue running her store so her customer can meet their needs by going to her store without going to larger commercial centers. She is seeking $500 to invest in buying merchandise like milk, meat, beer, gasoline, wine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luciana tiene 59 años, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella tiene una despensa en su casa desde hace más de 30 años. El almacén lo abrió en su casa propia, nos cuenta que ha tenido buenos y malos momentos, en el año 95 ella tuvo que cerrar su almacén debido a la gran crisis económica que atravesaba el país en ese momento. Gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos y marido, nuevamente pudo habilitar su despensa 4 años más tarde. En la misma ofrece productos de primera necesidad como frutas, verduras, leche, harina, fideos, etc. Gracias a su despensa puede aportar con los ingresos a la casa.

Debido a la fuerte emigración, Luciana, se ve preocupada pues muchos de sus clientes ya emigraron a España para buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo; no obstante, ella sigue luchando y dando la mejor atención para ganar nuevos clientes. Ella desea seguir surtiendo su despensa de modo a que sus clientes puedan satisfacer sus necesidades de compra en su negocio sin tener que ir a centros comerciales más grandes; solicita $ 500 para invertirlos en la compra de leche, carne, cerveza, gaseosas, vino, etc.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like vegetables, canned goods, cookies, candies, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 39 years old, and is married with four young children who are in school. Her husband is a carpenter and they live in a house which took a lot of work to build. Maria is a very enterprising woman, and because she and her husband come from humble families, Maria decided to start her own business in order to help her husband with the household costs. She decided to open a kiosk, starting from very little, initially selling only drinks and ice cream, and later, after some time had passed and she generated more profits, the business grew to include more products to sell such as fruits and bread and sodas. Maria is a well respected woman in her community for her leadership characteristics, and she's already started a commission in her neighborhood with the objective of improving the streets. Maria would like to continue growing her business and diversifying her sales, so she is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as vegetables, crackers, dairy products, frozen foods, etc. for her grocery store.

La señora María tiene 39 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos son aún pequeños y están en edad escolar. Su marido es carpintero y viven todos juntos en una casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, y debido a que ella y su marido provienen de familias humildes, María decidió montar su propio negocio para ayudar a su marido con los ingresos de la casa. Fue así que decidió abrir un kiosco; empezó el negocio desde muy abajo ya que en principio solo vendía bebidas y helados luego con el correr del tiempo y con las ganancias que generaba el negocio fue ampliándose e incorporando nuevos productos para la venta. Vende diferentes tipos de productos, como golosinas, gaseosas, frutas, pan, etc. María es una señora muy respetada en su comunidad por su carácter de líder, ya que integra una comisión de su barrio con el objetivo de mejorar las calles del barrio. Ella desea seguir progresando y diversificar sus ventas, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar más mercaderías como verduras, productos enlatados, galletitas, golosinas, lácteos, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca V. is 43 years old and happily married for 20 years to Lucio Gonzalez. Lucio is an agricultural engineer. They have four children, 19, 15, 10 and 6 years old who all attend school.

Blanca is a retired teacher, and these days she has a store which she started in 2006. It is strategically located in the municipal market in the city of Caaguazu, where she has an established customer base. The income from this helps her husband with the education of their children so that they can all finish school and get degrees.

The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise for her store, such as hoes, thermoses, sawdust, brooms and cement. With this she will be able to expand her stock of merchandise, and offer her customers better service and better quality.

La Sra. Blanca V. de 43 años de edad, está felizmente casada, desde hace 20 años con el Sr. Lucio Gonzalez de 44 años de edad, es Ingeniero Agrónomo y se encuentra ejerciendo tal profesión, tienen 4 hijos de 19, 15, 10 y 6 años respectivamente, quienes estan estudiando. Doña Blanca es profesora jubilada y actualmente se encuentra al frente de una ferreteria que se había iniciado en el año 2006, dicha ferreteria se encuentra estratégicamente ubicada en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Caaguazú, donde ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada, lo el ingreso que obtiene ayuda a su esposo para la educacion de sus hijos para que todos puedan obtener un titulo universitario El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercaderias, táles como: Azadas, termos, hojas de sierra, escoba de jardín y cemento. De este modo aumentará su stock de mercaderias y ofrecerá a sus clientes un mejor servicio con mayor calidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Mr. Ever Martinez is a single, 24 year old who lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú.

Ever is a young entrepreneur who, with the help of his parents, began his own business 5 years ago. Additionally, he has faithful customers who always come back because of the excellent service that he provides and because of the high quality of his products. Among the products that he sells are: nails, hammers, cables, paint, chainsaws, etc.

Ever is asking for a loan in order to enlarge his store, as one of his dreams is to attach a cell phone store to his hardware store. For this he needs to buy cell phones, cases, charges, etc. With this store, he will be able to offer his clients a greater variety of stock, while continuing to provide the good service that he is known for and retaining faithful clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Ever Martinez de 24 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente se encuentra viviendo con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguazú.

Ever es un jóven emprendedor que ya cuenta con su negocio propio el cual inicio hace 5 años con la ayuda de sus padres, además cuenta con una clientela bien formada que acuden al local por el excelente servicio que él les otorga y por sus productos de buena calidad. Entre los productos que vende citamos: clavos, martillos, cables, pintura, motocierras, etc.

Ever solicita el préstamo para la ampliación de su local ya que uno de sus sueños personales es anexar a su ferretería, un puesto de ventas de celulares necesita comprar celulares, estuches, cargadores,etc. Y asi ofrecer a sus clientes un stock más variado de productos, con la buena atención que le caracteriza y seguir manteniendolos como clientes fieles de su empresa.

loans.use: For the purchase of cellular phones, cases, charges, etc.

loans.name: Juan Servando

texts.es:
I am in urgent need of an extra room in my home, as I have two adolescent sons who need privacy; my house is very small and has only two rooms, a living room and a kitchen. I am requesting $1000 to invest in the construction of a room.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Me urge la construcción de un cuarto más en mi vivienda, debido a que tengo hijos adolescentes y necesitan privacidad, ya que mi casa es muy pequeña y solo tiene 2 cuartos, sala y cocina. Solicito $ 1200 para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Don Juan A. is 61 years old and happily married to Señora Paulina Bazan, who is 68 years old. They are the parents of a daughter who is 13 years old and a student of the 8th grade.

Señor Juan began this activity eleven years ago. Since then he had been working abroad so he could save up capital, and upon his return he invested it to begin his own carpentry shop. His carpentry shop has been growing more and more each day giving him a collection of top-level machinery and an expansion on his work garage, all thanks to the quality of his products and his good service.

Don Juan is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise like different types of wood, because with more raw materials he will be able to make a greater variety of furniture models, increase his stock of merchandise, and in this way offer top-quality furniture to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Don Juan A. de 61 años de edad, está felizmente casado con la Sra. Paulina Bazan de 68 años de edad. Son padres de una nena de 13 años de edad que es estudiante del 8º grado de la escuela primaria. El Señor Juan se inicio en esta actividad hace 11años, ya que hasta entonces él se encontraba trabajando en el extranjero, gracias a ello pudo ahorrar para su capital operativo, a su regreso lo invirtio para emprender su propia carpinteria. Cabe mencionar que su carpinteria va creciendo cada día más con su stock de maquinarias de primer nivel y la ampliación de su galpón, gracias a la calidad de sus productos y su buen servicio. Don Juan solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias como maderas aserradas y en rollos; ya que con mas materia prima, podrá fabricar muebles de variados modelos, para aumentar su stock de mercaderias y asi ofrecer a sus clientes muebles de primera calidad .

loans.use: To buy different types of wood for making his furniture

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Mr. Juan N. is 31 years old and happily married to Mrs. Gladys Martinez, 24 years old. They are the proud parents of Carlos N., 2 years old. Juan began working 15 years ago in an automobile electronics branch, a skill that he learned when he was only 16 years old. He worked in the body shop as an assistant. He continues to work in a body shop, however not as a helper now but rather as the owner. With much sacrifice and effort he was able to obtain his own shop beginning 6 years ago. Today he has many faithful clients due to the fact that he not only offers good service and good products, but also he does it in a personalized way.

Juan’s dream is to expand his business and with this be able to provide the best for his family and the best education for his son.

He asks for credit in order to be able to expand his business so that he can provide his customers with greater convenience and ease in their day to day activities.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan N. de 31 años de edad, está felizmente casado con la Sra. Gladys Martinez de 24 años de edad, son padres de una criatura de 2 años de nombre Carlos N..

Juan se inicio hace 15 años en la rama de la electricidad del automovil, profesión que aprendió teniendo tan solo 16 años de edad, trabajaba en un taller como auxiliar, actualmente lo sigue haciendo pero ya no como ayudante sino ya en su propio local desde hace 6 años que con sacrificio y mucho esfuerzo lo pudo conseguir y hoy ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada ya que no solo ofrece buenos servicios y buenos productos sino que tambien lo hace en forma personalizada.

El sueño personal de Juan es ampliar su local y de esta forma poder brindarle a su familia lo mejor y a su hijo la mejor educacion

Solicita el credito para poder ampliar su local para así poder brindar a sus clientes una mayor comodidad y facilidad en el manejo de sus actividades diarias.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
I need to build a fence in front of my house, for the sake of my family’s security. I work the night shift and my wife stays at home alone with the children. I wouldn’t want anything to happen to them, as there are many thugs in the neighborhood. I am requesting $800 for the construction of a fence in front of my house.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Por la seguridad de mi familia necesito construir una barda al frente de mi casa, ya que mi trabajo es en el turno de noche y mi esposa se queda sola con mis hijos. No quisiera que les fuera a pasar algo debido a que en este fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes. Solicito $800 para la construcción de una barda al frente de mi casa.

loans.use: Construction of a fence in front of my house.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Señora Eleuteria is 63 years old. She is a widow. She has 3 adult daughters who are married and live on their own. She has 3 grandchildren who are the love of her life! She tells us that her husband died 10 years ago and since then she lives by herself.

Señora Eleuteria has been in the grocery business for more than 14 years. She sells basic products such as bread, rice, sugar, fine noodles, etc. She acquired this store thanks to her hard-working husband who used to farm vegetables. They saved all the money they could to one day have the necessary capital to start their own business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise in bulk. This way she is able to get discounts and she can sell them at a lesser price, but in more quantity. She would like to be able to increase her sales and increase her bottom line.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eleuteria tiene 63 años es viuda, tiene 3 hijas mayores de edad, casadas e independientes, 3 nietos que son su felicidad. Nos cuenta que hace 10 años falleció su esposo y desde entonces vive sola en la casa. La señora cuenta con una despensa hace 14años en donde vende productos de primera necesidad tales como: fideos, panificados, arroz, azucar,etc., este negocio lo adquirio gracias al trabajo de su esposo y al apoyo incondicional que le brindaba su esposo quien en vida se dedicaba al cultivo de hortalizas, asi poco a poco fueron ahorrando para tener un capital para invertir en el negocio. Solicita este préstamo para comprar mercaderias al por mayor ya que de esa manera adquiere descuentos, los cuales le ayuda a reducir los costos de las mercaderias y venderlos en cantidad, de ésta forma podrá aumnetar en gran medida sus ingresos y obtener un mayor margen de utilidad.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise such as flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gervacio

texts.es:
Señor Gervacio is 38 years old. He is separated from his wife. He has one child named Richard who is 8 years old and goes to school. He lives in the city of Itaugua with his mother and his little boy. He is the only breadwinner in the family.

Señor Gervacio tells us that he has been a mechanic since he was 8 years old. It was out of necessity that he started working at a very young age due to the fact that his family was very poor. He started as an assistant in many of the mechanic shops around the city and travelled to Argentina as well. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, he has been able to open up his own mechanic shop. He would like to give his son the opportunity to go to school and get an education since he was unable to do so due to the lack of money. He would also like to keep his current 4 employees.

He is requesting this loan to purchase more tools such as screwdrivers, a winch, pliers, etc to provide better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gervacio tiene 38 años, es separado y tiene un hijo llamado Richard de 8 años de edad quien va a la escuela, actualmente vive en la Ciudad de Itaugua con su madre y su pequeño hijo, en este momento él es el sosten de ambos Gervacio cuenta que inicio esta actividad teniendo tan solo 8 años, tuvo la necesidad de empezar a trabajar ya que provenia de una familia muy humilde, empezo trbajando como ayudante en varios talleres de la Capital y por motivos de trabajo viajó a la Argentina, actualmente gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacion logro instalar su propio taller para de esta forma poder brindarle a su hijo una educacion a la que él por falta de recuros económicos no pudo acceder y tambien poder darle trabajo a 4 personas que estan trabajando para él en el taller. Solicita este préstamo para comprar maquinarías y elementos de trabajo como destornilladores, pinzas, torno, etc; y así mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase machinery & other work tools

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
"I need to put a concrete roof on the front of my house, since I haven't been able to finish the construction due to lack of money and the space for my family is very reduced." I am soliciting $700.00 for the construction of a concrete roof.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Me hace falta poner un techo de concreto al frente de mi casa ya que no he podido terminar la construcción por falta de dinero y el espacio es muy reducido para mi familia”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la construcción del techo de concreto

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefina lives in the area of Linares in Nuevo León. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a laborer. To improve her family's lives, Maria started her business 19 years ago, after she had undergone various costly treatments to be able to have children. She decided to sell groceries because one of her sisters-in-law was in contact with suppliers and provided Maria with a loan to start. Now she continues her business and fortunately, she has developed it with her hard work and dedication.

To continue growing her business, Maria needs a loan of $375, which she will use to buy more merchandise to stock up her business and thus, offer good service to her customers. She promies to repay this loan in 4 months. Be an important part of this business and in the lives of this family, who sincerely thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Josefina vive en la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León, está casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo es obrero y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia desde hace 19 años Maria inició su negocio, en aquel momento pasaban por costosos tratamientos para poder tener hijos, se decidió por la venta de abarrotes porque uno de sus cuñados tenía contacto con los proveedores que después le otorgaron crédito a Maria, ahora ella continúa con su negocio y afortunadamente lo ha hecho crecer con mucho trabajo y dedicación.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, que agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Osman Omar

texts.es:
Hello my name is Osman Omar, i am a merchant with a business named "El Rubi" selling jewellery from my home. I also sell these products door to door in my city. For a number of years i have dedicated myself to this type of work, which brings me enough sales to cover the spending costs of my family and other commitments to suppliers. Thanks to the sales of these products my sons are able to go to school. It is important to mention that currently my customer demands have grown since they learned of the quality of my products and its necessary for me to invest more to satisfy those customers.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Osman Omar, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de joyas llamdo "El Rubi" en mi casa de habitación, producto que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en mi ciudad. cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con proveedores, gracias a los ingresos de este negocio mis hijos pueden estudiar, es importante mensionar que en la actualidad la demanda de cliente a crecido ya que ellos conocen la calidad de mi producto y necesito de mayor inversión para satisfacer a los cliente.

loans.use: Purchase chains, bangles, earrings, rings, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Amparo. I am a merchant and I have a small bakery business, which is located in my house. Thanks to the income I receive from this business I can contribute to paying my family’s expenses. I have given an education to my children; they have their high school degrees. I deliver my product to houses in my town. I currently need to invest in ingredients and fuel, taking into account that my volume of sales is increasing and I don’t have sufficient capital to meet existing demand, since I began this business with my own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es amparo, soy comerciante, tengo un pequeño negocio de Reposteria, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, gracias a los ingresos que persivo de este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, he dado educación a mis hijos logrando asi que ellos obtuvieran su titulo de Educación Media, mi producto lo distribuyo a domicilio en mi ciudad. Actualmente es necesario una mayor inversión, tomando en cuenta que el volumen de venta es mayor y en estos momentos no cuento con el capital suficiente para hacerle frente a la demanda existente, ya que este negocio lo inicie con esfuerzo propio.

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, sugar, cream, margarine, and firewood

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Mi name is Manuel de Jesus. Let me tell you that my main activity is in commerce. I have a micro enterprise. I make and distribute candy peddling the different small general and grocery stores of the city.

I have been dedicated to this business for several years. Thank God with the income I make from the business I can cover family expenses as well as commitments to my suppliers. I am very happy because this is a family micro enterprise since my wife and her children help out in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mi nombre es Manuel de Jesus, dejeme contarle que mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una micro Empresa de Dulces, los que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en las diferentes pulperia de mi ciudad. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, gracias a Dios con los ingresos que percibo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos familiares y asi mismo cumplir con los compromisos con los proveedores, me siento muy contento porque esta es una micro Empresa familiar ya que mi esposa y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: Purchasing bananas, plastic bags, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Arsenia. My main activity is the making and selling of Tortillas. I have my own business called Tortillas "LAS RIQUÍSIMAS" (The Delicious). I have a good clientèle and experience in this type of business.

Thank God, with the income from this business I can help my husband with the family expenses, and the most important of this all is that it allows me to see for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Hola mi nombre es Arsenia, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Tortillas, cuento con un pequeño negocio llamado Torillas"LAS RIQUISIMAS", cuento con buena clientela y experciencia en este tipo de negocio, gracias a Dios con los ingresos de este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la familia y lo mas importante de todo esto es que que me permite atender a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and firewood

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria Elba. I am a merchant and I have my own business selling clothing and shoes that is located in front of the Boulevard of my city. I have been in this type of business for several years. I am a single mother with three children. Thanks to the income from this business, I am able to cover the expenses of food, education, health and other things. My husband emigrated and I haven’t heard anything from him. I need to stock my business well, since a good sales season is approaching, and be able to offer a variety of products to customers. In this way I can improve my income and my family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria Elba, soy comerciente, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa y Calzado ubicado frente al Boulervar de mi ciudad. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, soy madre soltera y con tres hijos los que gracias a los ingresos de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación, salud y otros, ya que mi esposop emigro y no se nada de el. Necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se acerca la temporada de mayor venta y asi ofrecer variedad de productos al cliente, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida de mi familia.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts, t-shirts, dress pants, children's shirts and shoes, and tennis shoes

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
My name is Martina and I am a merchant. I am a single mother and a senior citizen. Thanks be to God, I feel strong and can work. I have a small business selling new clothing and shoes, located in the city center. I have been working in this business for several years, and it generates income to cover the different expenses of the home and to pay other obligations incurred. Thanks to the income from this business, I have improved my home bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Martina, soy comerciante, madre soltera y de la tercera edad, gracias a Dios me siento fuerte y puedo trabaja, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para l cubrir los diferentes gastos en el hogar tambien para cumplir con los compromisos adquiridos. Gracias a las utilidades de este negocio he mejorado poco a poco mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, sandles, women's and girl's pants, and children's clothing

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Karen Elizabeth. I am a merchant and I work in sales. I have my own business selling shoes in front of the Boulevard of my city. I have been doing this for three years and it generates income to cover my family’s expenses. I am a single mother and I have one son. With the income from this business, I have been able to pay, bit by bit, for a small piece of land where I plan to build my house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Karen Elizabeth, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de zapatos frente al Boulervar de mi ciudad. tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo, con las utilidades que me genera este negocio he pagado poco ha poco un solar en el que pienso construir mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy women's shoes, men's shoes, sandals, sandals for girls and boys, and blouses and skirts

loans.name: Puaaelo

texts.en:
Puaaelo is one of the old members in the Sologa Mulifanua Center. She is on her fifth loan and she is still running her Samoan oil business together with an additional business of weaving fine mats.

Although the loan seems big compared to the business, Puaaelo, as mentioned before, also weaves and sells fine mats at very high prices. These fine mats are more sellable in times of funerals, weddings and other events. So when people are in need, they buy these fine mats from her. The cost of 20 inches of fine matting is usually two thousand to two thousand and fifty dollars for one. So if she can sell two to three fine mats a month, that will be more income for her.

loans.use: “Buy twenty iron roofs, nails and timber for house improvement”

loans.name: Izafa

texts.en:
Izafa S. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin district of Azerbaijan in the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict territory. She settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 41 years old and married with 3 children. Izafa is the only breadwinner in her family.

Having borrowed a first loan of $500 from Normicro, she opened a shop. The second time, she borrowed $800 and built a grocery store. All her loans were paid back timely. The third time, she applied for a $1,000 loan from KIVA for expanding the area of her shop and increasing the assortment of food for sale. She has already achieved this goal and paid all her monthly payments in time.

Izafa now needs another $1,200 loan from Kiva to expand her business further, open a vegetables section in the store and buy digital scales. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family with the additional expansion of her business.

loans.use: To expand her business, open a vegetables section in her stores and to buy a set of digital scales.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en: Ofelya A., her husband and daughter live in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. She has been operating a small clothes store in the middle of Beylagan for 15 years.  She mostly sells women's clothes. Her husband helps her to sell. Ofelya needs $600 to purchase more kind of goods and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Zabita

texts.en: Zabita is a 32 year old widow with two children. After her husband died, she was left alone with two children to look after. During this time, she suffered a lot and had no choice but to start a very small retail trade business. Income from turnover of such a tiny capital, of course, isn't enough to provide her children with  basic necessities.Therefore, Zabita has applied for  a $500 loan from the Normicro Saatl branch. This amount would be quite enough to provide a monthly income to support Zabita's family.

loans.use: To increase variety of business

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif I. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is married and has 2 children. Asif has been running a café in the Beylagan city bazaar for 8 years now. When he first started, he borrowed 2 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling $1,000. He used those loans to increase the size of his café. He also has an employee who works as a waiter while Asif cooks the meals.

He is now requesting $900 to purchase some tables and chairs for his café to accommodate a greater number of customers.

loans.use: To expand his cafe

loans.name: Giyas

texts.en:
Giyas is 39 and married with two children . He and his family live in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Giyas and his son (shown in the picture) run a family cattle-rearing business. Giyas sells beef in the Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle.

However, the income from their four cows is too low to support the family and another cow would help their financial situation. In the Caucasus region, a good cow costs about $300-400. Therefore, Giyas has applied to Norwegian Microcredit - Saatli branch for a $450 loan to buy another cow to boost his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a busy entrepreneur from Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She runs two kiosks where she sells a nice selection of women’s dresses and hats. Married with two children, Alla started her business not long after graduating from college. One of her biggest motivations for operating her business is to provide for the needs of her children.

She has had one kiosk for several years at a great location at a market near a train station and manufacturing plant. The market is open late and stays open on weekends, allowing vendors there to earn extra income. Alla recently opened a second kiosk and has requested a loan to help purchase a supply of inventory to stock the new location. Her goal is to develop her business to the point where it will make money without her being as directly involved. This loan will be a big help as she works toward her goal and provides for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase the inventory for her second kiosk

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov has built a profitable business selling women’s dress suits at the busy Alexsandrovski market in Zaporoshye. She has done well by concentrating on a product that she is interested in and where there is not a lot of competition. Lubov has been in business for six years. She recently was able to expand her business with the addition of a second kiosk. She is looking forward to developing it and making it successful. Lubov is divorced and has one grown son who is married. He and his wife are currently living with Lubov, so she helps with some of their expenses. 

Lubov has requested a loan for $1000 to purchase additional inventory for the summer season. Previous loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a great help to Lubov.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: With over ten years of experience as an entrepreneur, Marina L. manufactures and sells footwear in the central city market of Zaporozhye. Married with three children, Marina lived and worked in Chernobyl after the nuclear explosion. As a result, she has suffered lasting health complications that require ongoing treatment. Marina works with professionalism and dedication. She is optimistic and hard-working, with plans to increase her footwear manufacturing and sales business. Marina has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for six years. A successful microfinance entrepreneur, Marina has maintained a perfect credit history. She is currently seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase new inventory and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya R. has been selling fresh citrus and tropical fruits in the green market of Mukachevo, Ukraine for ten years. A true entrepreneur, Nataliya studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Nataliya is industrious and enterprising – she is focused on her business and is determined to expand her vending facility. Nataliya is currently seeking a loan for $1,000. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh fruits and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Nataliya hopes to open additional vending kiosks and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of inventory at her grocery kiosk

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
M. Arzu has been a refugee since 1993. She is originally from the district of Azerbaijan in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory. She began her business with $200 in 2001. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and limited working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important needs. She had difficulty paying for medication, clothes, school etc. 

             In 2005, after borrowing $500 from Normicro, Arzu was able to expand her business, increase her profits and improve her family's livelihood.  The second loan she borrowed was for $850 which she used to expanded her shop and increase the amount of goods sold.
             
Arzu needs a $1200 loan in order to further develop her business.  She wants to buy other types of goods and start selling shoes to increase her profits and improve her family’s living conditions.  She would use this additional income to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy other goods and open shoe area

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Ms. Gregoria is 44 years old, she is a widow and has 5 children, two of whom are boys and three girls. She tells us that, because of economic problems and the lack of well-paying jobs, 2 of her daughters had to emigrate to Spain to improve their income and in that way help their family.

Due to economic problems and the illness of her husband, Gregoria had to sell her house and practically all the assets that the couple had, in order to travel with her entire family to Argentina so that her husband could follow a course of medical treatment in that country, a treatment which, sadly, did not give results and her husband passed away after some time, five years ago. With the blows life was giving her at that time, and in a foreign country, she saw the necessity of returning to Paraguay, to start all over again from zero.

She started out selling merchandise in the street. At that time she had just one big bag which she carried on her back, going from house to house offering her products. In this way she made working capital and, little by little, with much sacrifice, her business kept growing. She had the chance to buy a new house and in that way raise her 5 children and offer them a good education. Today, she already has a good quantity of customers, and thanks to her effort and the support of her children, she is able to open a small business inside her own home.

With the loan she is requesting, she plans to expand her stock of merchandise. She needs to buy more clothing, footwear, and gloves, and in that way augment her economic income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Gregoria tiene 44 años , es viuda y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos son varones y tres mujeres, nos cuenta que por problemas económicos y por falta de trabajo con una buena remuneracion 2 de sus hijas tuvo la necesidad de emigrar a España para de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y asi poder ayudar a su familia .

Por problemas económicos y enfermedad de su esposo, Gregoria, tuvo que vender su casa y prácticamente todos los bienes que la pareja tenia en ese momento para viajar con toda su familia a la Argentina para que su esposo siga en ese país un tratamiento médico, tratamiento que lastimosamente no dio resultado y su esposo falleció luego de un tiempo, de eso ya hace 5 años. Con los golpes que la vida en ese momento le estaba dando y en un país extranjero se vio con la necesidad de volver al Paraguay para de esta forma volver a empezar todo de cero.

Empezo vendiendo mercaderias por las calles, en ese entonces contaba con un solo bolson que llevaba sobre su espalda y llegaba casa por casa a ofrecer sus productos, asi de fue haciendo de capital operativo y poco a poco con mucho sacrificio fue acrecentando su negocio y se volvio a comprar una nueva casa y asi pudo criar a sus 5 hijos y ofrecerles una buena educaion. Actualmente ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientela y gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus hijos puedo abrir un pequeño negocio dentro de su propia casa.

Con el crédito que solicita piensa en ampliar su stock de mercaderias, necesita comprar mas ropas, calzados, medias, guantes, para de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos economicos.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, footwear, gloves, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and lives with Juan Rojas, with whom she has a 10 year old son. They live in a very poor area known for overhead power lines looming over family homes, but due to their financial situation, that is where they make their home.

Maria has run a small kiosk for the past 10 years, where she sells home made foods. She is also currently selling medicinal mate-based teas (a hot beverage very popular during the winter months). She gets up at 5 in the morning to do her shopping and returns by 7 am to open her business and serve her main customers, who are the school children in the area.

Maria's dream is to have her own food brand known throughout her country and to teach other women the art of cooking, showing them that it is possible to get ahead with this type of business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a display case to keep her foods warm and meet her customers' needs, allowing her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María tiene 39 años, esta en pareja con Juan Rojas quien se dedica a la venta, y tienen un hijo de 10 años. Ellos habitan en una zona muy humilde, conocida por no ser un lugar bueno para vivir ya que existe el riesgo de los Cables de Alta Tensión ubicados prácticamente encimas de sus casas, pero la falta de recursos económicos hizo que la familia de María viva allí. María cuenta con un pequeño kiosko desde hace 10 años, donde ella elabora comestibles para vender, actualmente esta innovando en la elaboración de remedios para mate (bebida caliente muy consumida, especialmente durante la temporada de invierno). María se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer sus compras y volver para antes de las 7 de la mañana para poder abrir su negocio ya que sus mayores clientes son los niños de la zona que van a la escuela. María sueña con tener un marca reconocida en el país de sus comidas y poder tener oportunidad de enseñar a otras mujeres el arte de la cocina y mostrarles que con este oficio se puede salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para poder adquirir una vitrina, de esta forma poder conservar el calor de los alimentos y aumentar sus ventas de manera a satidfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase a display case

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a nurse/midwife managing her own private facility in Meru, which is in eastern Kenya.  She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and three children.  She was certified as a nurse/midwife in 1974. She worked at Meru District Hospital, a government facility, until 2006 when she retired and opted to start her own clinic.  Her clinic is located in the middle of a market, which is where she draws most of her clients. She offers a wide range of health services including general medical services, family planning, maternal and child health services.  She also runs a pharmacy and a laboratory at the site.  Joyce attributes her success to hard work, perseverance and financial assistance from K-MET.  She needs a loan of US $1200 to purchase additional stocks of drugs and also integrate other services into her clinic that are in high demand.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of drugs

loans.name: María Porfiria

texts.es:
Señora Maria Porfiria is 60 years old and is separated. She has four children already married and working in various jobs. They have given her grandchildren, who are her source of happiness.

Doña Porfiria has had a sales position at the market in her city for 20 years. She is dedicated to selling medicinal products, creams, essences, and natural herbs. She began doing this 22 years ago by offering these products from house to house, but thanks to her efforts she now has a spot at the market.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in bulk so she can divide it and offer it to travelling sellers. In this way she will grow her economy, and as she says, take care of herself, without bothering her children since she did not have the possibility of saving for a secure retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria Porfiria tiene 60 años es separada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad ya casados y trabajan en diversas actividades, manifiesta que tiene varios nietos que son su felicidad. Doña Porfiria tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de esta cuidad hace 20 años, se dedica a vender productos medicinales , cremas , esencias, hierbas naturales, empezo con esta actividad hace 22 años y lo tuvo que hacer recorriendo casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos, gracias a sus esfuerzon logro instalarse en el mercado Ella solicita este crédito para comprar mercaderias en cantidad y asi las fracciona y las provee a varios vendedores ambulantes, de esta manera ira creciendo su economia y como ella misma dice autosostenerse , sin molestar a sus hijos ya que ella no tuvo la posibilidad de pagar un seguro jubilatorio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like medicinal products, creams, essences, and natural herbs.

loans.name: Shahbeyim

texts.en: Shahbeyim J. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. She is married and has three children. She owns a small booth in Beylagan city bazaar and engages in clothing sales. She mostly sells children clothes. She established her business ten years ago. She purchases the clothes from an airport trading center in Baku. She needs $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Floric

texts.en: Floric (in a white coat) is a 45 year old trained nurse. She is a single mother of two daughters. Floric became a registered nurse in 1984. She worked with the government hospital for three years before starting her own clinic in 1989 .  Her clinic is situated in the Runyenjes Embu District. She offers a variety of services including general services, family planning, child welfare and operates a laboratory. The community appreciates the quality services that her facility provides. She requires US $1200 to further expand her clinic.

loans.use: Clinic expansion

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshen G. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwest Azerbaijan. He is married and has four children who are in school. He owns a small booth in Beylagan's city bazaar. He sells a variety of clothes with his wife. They established their business thirteen years ago. He needs $1100 to purchase more goods to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is 33 years old and is married to Elpidio Alfonzo, with whom she has three children, two boys and a girl. She comes from a very humble family and had to work from a young age. She tells us that she's been fortunate to have made a home with a good man and that through their combined effort and hard work they have been able to open a small grocery store which has grown day by day. Due to a serious illness that befell her husband, and the many expenses it generated, they had to close their business due to a lack of working capital.

In spite of all these obstacles, Petrona was able to provide for her children and reopen her shop, which is their only means of support. In her store she sells quality products like milk, baked goods, sugar, flour, etc.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store so that she can continue to attract more customers and consequently keep her children in school.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Petrona G. de Alfonzo tiene 33 años esta casada con el señor Elpidio Alfonzo con quien tiene 3 hijos, dos varones y una nena. Petrona proviene de una familia muy humilde motivo por el cual desde muy joven tuvo que salir a trabajar, nos cuenta que tuvo la suerte de encontrar un buen hombre con quien ha formado un hogar y gracias al sacrificio y el esfuerzo de ambos pudieron abrir una pequeña despensa que dia a dia iba creciendo, hasta que una fuerte enfermedad que atacó al Sr. Elpidio tuvieron que cerrar el negocio por falta de capital operativo, ya que tenia muchos gastos. A pesar de todo Petrona con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante a sus hijos, y volvio a reabrir su despensa, que es su actual medio de vida. En su despensa vende diferentes tipos de productos de primera necesidad como leche, panificados, azúcar, harina, etc. Solicita el credito para aumentar sus mercaderias para asi volver a surtir su negocio y de esta forma atraer mas clientes ya que ella quiere que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, coffee, flour, sugar, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
Rumilda Colman de Gamarra is 46 years old. She is married to Pantaleón Gamarra, who works in horticulture, and they have 6 children.

Rumilda came from a very poor family and had to work from the time she was very young. She helped her parents with her income.

Rumilda currently sells merchandise such as nylon stockings, cosmetics, cleaning supplies, etc. On the weekends she helps her husband with his horticulture (he raises vegetables). She says that she dreams of opening a small store in her home and a small plant nursery. This way she could spend more time at home and wouldn’t have to sell in the street. She could spend more time with her children and better supervise their education.

She is requesting the loan to be able to increase her stock of merchandise and thereby increase her income. Demand has increased lately and she needs a greater variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rumilda Colman de Gamarra tiene 46 años, esta casado con Pantaleón Gamarra que se dedica a la horticultura y tienen 6 hijos. Rumilda desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de salir a la calle a trabajar, ya que provenia de una familia muy humilde con dichos ingresos ayudaba a sus padres Doña Rumilda actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercerías tales como medias, cosmeticos, articulo de limpieza etc. Los fin de semana ella ayuda a su espoco con su trabajo de horticultura (cultivo de hortalizas), ella nos cuenta que en el futuro sueña con poner en su casa un pequeño negocio de ventas de mercerias y un pequeño vivero para de esta forma poder quedar mas en su casa y ya no tener que salir a la calle, asi ella podrá compartir mas tiempo con sus hijos siguiendo de mas de cerca la educacion de los mismos. Solicita el crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías y asi poder aumentar sus ingresos, ya que en estos tiempos la demanda ha aumentado y necesita mas variedad de mercaderias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shoes, children's clothing, face creams, etc.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs. Silvina is 43 years old and has been with Mr. Elario Mendez for 25 years who works  in construction .  They have 5 children one of 25 years already married, Zunilda of 22 that wishes to study secretaryship, Fabiana of 19 that is dedicated to sales and Cinthia of 14 years old is still in school school. 

Doña Silvina is a very ambitious woman, always dedicated to the purchase and sale of fruits and vegetables.  Through the shared group of women granted in the Paraguayan Foundation, they began with a capital of $ 60 for its pantry, and with time and its constant work, Silivina, obtained that its business grew gradually. Now it has greater variety of merchandises like fruits, vegetables, milk, bread, flour, sugar among others. She dreams that their daughters can become professionals and form a happy home, like the one of her, since even though they did not have much to eat.

She needs the loan to buy merchandises like notebooks, papers, fine cardboards, pencils and all the articles of bookstore, since near his house there is a small school and the students ask for these equipment frequently.




ORIGINAL SPANISH

La Señora Silvina tiene 43 años  esta en pareja con el Sr. Elario Mendez  hace 25 años quien se dedica a la construccion, tienen 5 hijos uno de 25 años ya casado, Zunilda de 22 que desea estudiar secretariado, Fabiana de 19 que se dedica a la venta, y Cinthia de 14 que esta en el colegio.

 Doña Silvina es una mujer muy asendosa, siempre se dedicó a la compra y  venta de frutas y  verduras, hasta que consguió un prestamo através del grupo solidario de mujeres otorgados en la Fundación Paraguaya, comenzó con un capital de $ 60 para su despensa, y con el tiempo y su constante trabajo, Silivina, logró que su negocio creciera paulatinamente. Ahora posee mayor variedad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, leche, pan, harina, azúcar entre otros. Ella  sueña  que sus hijas sean profesionales y formen un hogar feliz, como el de ella, ya que aún cuando no tenían para comer la familia tenía mucho para compartir.

Necesita el credito para  comprar  mercaderías como cuadernos, papeles, cartulinas, lápices y todos los artículos de librería, ya que cerca de su casa hay una escuelita y los alumnos solicitan con frecuencia estos útiles.

loans.use: para  comprar  mercaderías como cuadernos, papeles, cartulinas, lápices y todos los artículos de librería

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is a 41 year old woman, who is married and has 3 children. She has a dining room in her house, from which she gives food to people who work in the offices and businesses in her area. She started with little savings, and with time it has grown thanks to the support of her husband and the help of credit obtained by the Paraguaya Foundation. Marta is a very dynamic woman, who gets up very early in order to start her day's labor, owing to the numerous breakfast orders she receives from her clients, as well as carrying out her own domestic tasks as a mother. She comments that she is content that with effort and honest work she can give a good education to her children. The loan she requests is in the amount of $200 and she will invest it in the purchase of wine, carbonated water, beer, fruit, delicacies, meat, and eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva volunteer

La señora Marta tiene 41 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee un comedor en su misma casa donde da de comer a personas que trabajan en las oficinas y comercios de la zona. Empezó con unos pocos ahorros y con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias al apoyo de su marido y la ayuda de los créditos obtenidos en la Fundación Paraguaya.Marta, es una señora muy dinámica, ya que se despierta muy temprano para iniciar su jornada laboral, debido a los numerosos pedidos de desayuno que recibe de sus clientes, como así también realizar las tareas doméstica propia de una madre. Comenta que está contenta de que con su esfuerzo y trabajo honesto puede darles una buena educación a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita ahora es de $200 y los invertirá en la compra de vino, gaseosas, cervezas, frutas, golosinas, carne y huevo.

loans.use: To purchase wine, carbonated water, beer, fruit, delicacies, meat, and eggs.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Señora Marta is 41 years old. She is married and her husband's name is Ladislao Cespedes. They have 5 children and they all go to school which is about 8 blocks from their home.

She makes chipas and she sells them by travelling all around the neighborhoods in different cities. Chipa is a traditional food and very popular in Paraguay. It's similar to bread and it's made out of starch, cheese, milk, vegetable oil, etc. She has a small shop in her home where she makes her chipas and her family help her make around 200 chipas a day. The cities where she makes most of her money are San Lorenzo and Fernando de la Mora which are located one hour away from Caacupe.

Marta tells us that with this job, she and her husband have been able to have a roof over their head, provide food for their family and provide an education to their children. Lately sales have been low and to be able to sell all her chipas, Marta has to walk all around town until she sells all her chipas because if she doesn't sell them then she doesn't make money.

She also tells us that she went to many different lending institutions to try to get a loan, but nobody was willing to let her borrow money since she doesn't have many references/credentials. Fundacion Paraguaya was the only one who helped her to get a loan . Thanks to that loan she was able to build a brick oven because previously she was renting her neighbor's brick oven to make her chipas.

At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase main ingredients such as eggs, milk, starch and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marta, tiene 41 años, ella es casada, su marido se llama Ladislao Céspedes y tienen 5 hijos; todos van a la escuela que queda a 8 cuadras de su domicilio. Ella elabora y vende chipas de forma ambulante, recorriendo barrios de diferentes ciudades. La chipa es una comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y está hecho a base de almidón, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Posee una pequeña fábrica de chipa en su domicilio que con la ayuda de sus hijos y su marido realizan la producción de 200 chipas por día, su zona de mayor venta son las ciudades de San Lorenzo y Fernando de la Mora que quedan a 1 hora de la ciudad de Caacupé. Comenta Marta, que con este trabajo ella y su marido pudieron hacerse de una casa, y que aunque es pequeña, sirve para dar techo, comida, y educación a sus hijos. No obstante las ventas últimamente han bajado y para poder vender todas las chipas producidas en el día debe caminar mucho hasta vaciar su canasto, ya que si no las vende todas, recuperar esa pérdida resulta difícil. Ella cuenta que para obtener un préstamo recorrió varias entidades financieras, pues nadie aceptaba las pocas referencias que ella tenía, pero la única que la apoyo fue la Fundación Paraguaya, gracias a eso pudo construir un horno, porque anteriormente alquilaba el horno que tenía su vecino para poder cocinar sus chipas. Hoy solicita el crédito para poder comprar materias prima como huevos, leche, almidón y queso.

loans.use: To purchase main ingredients such as milk, eggs, starch and cheese

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Señora Marta is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has a small grocery store where she sells all types of products mainly milk, bread, coffee, flour, noodles, cooking oil, etc.

She has been in the grocery business for more than 12 years. It was very difficult at first like with any small business venture you start on your own. She started her business with a small amount of capital which her brothers let her borrow. With time, her business grew. With the previous loans she obtained from Funcacion Paraguaya (Foundation of Paraguay), she was able to diversify her merchandise by purchasing clothes and shoes to sell.

She tells us that she has been able to make her dream come true which was to one day have her own business which is profitable and helps her support her family.

She would like a loan to purchase more merchandise such as milk, meat, beer, soda, cooking oil and noodles since they are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marta tiene 40 años, ella está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Posee una despensa donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como leche, pan, café, harina, fideos, aceite, etc. Se inicio en esta actividad hace mas de 12 años, como todo nuevo emprendimiento, al comienzo fue difícil y comenzó con poco capital que le prestaron sus hermanos, pero con el tiempo y gracias a las buenas ventas ella pudo ir ampliando su negocio. Con préstamos que obtuvo anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya ella pudo diversificar sus mercaderías para la venta y compro ropas y calzados para vender. Su principal logro dice fue la de cumplir su objetivo de tener su propio negocio que hoy día le permite aportar con los ingresos de la casa y abastecer a la familia. Desea adquirir un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como leche, carne, cerveza, gaseosas, aceite y fideos ya que estos son los de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as milk, meat, beer, soda, cooking oil & noodles

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 33 years old. She is a single hairstylist. She has her own beauty salon which is located in downtown Caacupe. She has been doing this for the past 10 years and she has a steady clientele composed primarly of public figures and government/city employees.

Some of the type of jobs she does are manicures, pedicures and all sorts of hair cuts and/or hair styles, etc.

She tells us that her main satisfaction is that her dream came true since now she has her own beauty salon with all the neccessary equipment to do her job well.

She would like to build a glass stand where she would like to display other beauty products she would like to sell such as facial cremes, body lotions, perfumes, jewelry, etc. In order to be able to purchase these products, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 33 años, ella es soltera, y es peluquera. Ella tiene su propio salón de belleza que está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caacupé. Se dedica a este oficio hace ya más de 10 años y ya posee una clientela fija constituida mayormente por funcionarias públicas de la Municipalidad y la Gobernación de la ciudad. Entre los trabajos que ella realiza podemos citar: manicura, pedicuro, tintes, peinados, cortes de cabello, etc. Comenta que su mayor satisfacción es ver realizado su sueño, ya que hoy día tiene ya su salón propio con las herramientas necesarias para realizar hasta los trabajos más exigentes. Ahora tiene como proyecto habilitar en su peluquería un stand de vidrio donde podrá exhibir mercaderías para vender, como cremas, lociones, perfumes, joyas entre otros. Para poder comprar estos productos ella desea obtener un préstamo de $ 200.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as hand and facial lotions, perfume and jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael is 35 years old. He's married with 4 children. He has a small shop in his home where he makes "chipas." Chipa is a traditional type of food in Paraguay. It's similar to bread and it's made with starch, cheese, milk, vegetable oil, etc.

He makes chipas early in the morning, so that he can then go out and sale them all around the barrios (neighborhoods) in the city. Rafael makes sure that he is present whenever there is a school event or political campaign so that he can sell his delicious chipas which are a main delight to the people from Paraguay.

Rafael tells us that this is hard work since he has to work a lot of hours in the day until he sells all of his chipas, and to start all over again the next day. But it doesn't matter because his main goal is to provide for his family and to make sure all their basic necessities are taken care of.

In order to increase production, he would like to build another brick oven, which in the language of Guarani is called "Tatakua". This special type of oven is used by many of the people who make chipa. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Rafael tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 4 hijos. El posee una pequeña fábrica de chipas en su domicilio. La chipa es una comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y está hecho a base de almidón, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Realiza su producción diariamente a tempranas horas de la mañana, para luego salir a venderlas de forma ambulante, recorriendo los barrios de la ciudad. Cuando se realiza eventos en colegios, universidades o de campañas políticas, el siempre se hace presente y lleva en su canasto chipas calentitas que son el mayor deleite de los paraguayos. Rafael, nos comenta que este oficio es muy sacrificado que uno debe trabajar muchas horas diarias para poder vender todas sus chipas y producirlas de nuevo. No obstante dice que su logro principal es que mediante este oficio puede mantener a su familia y cubrir por lo menos las necesidades básicas de la misma. Para aumentar su producción él desea construir otro horno de ladrillos y barro, llamado en el idioma guaraní TATAKUA que significa horno y es el más utilizado por los productores de chipa para hornear sus productos. Para esto necesita un crédito de $ 400.

loans.use: To build a brick oven made out of clay/mud

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Rosa is 46 years old. She is married with 2 children. She is a travelling saleswoman. She sells used clothes and silver jewelry. She buys used clothes from a store in Asuncion (capital city which is about 2 hours away). She travels once to twice a week to the city to make her purchases. She buys her silver jewelry from a jewelry store located in downtown Caacupe.

Rosa tells us that her job is very unforgiving since she is exposed to the elements. Wheather is rain, hot or cold, she must get out there to sell her products around the city, one barrio (neighborhood) at a time. She is hoping to add a room to her house to give her the space she needs for her merchandise. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD to purchase more used clothes and jewelry. This way she can work from home but still be able to take care of her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 46 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas y también a la venta de joyas de plata de forma ambulante. Las ropas usadas compra de una tienda en Asunción (capital del país que queda a dos horas de viaje), por lo que viaja una a dos veces por semana para comprarla, las joyas de plata las compra de una joyería del centro de la ciudad de Caacupé. Rosa, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que a pesar de las lluvias, el frío y el calor ella debe salir a vender sus productos recorriendo los barrios de la ciudad. Por este motivo ella desea habilitar un salón de ventas en su casa, para ello necesita un crédito de $ 200 para comprar ropas y joyas en mayor cantidad para la venta. De esta forma ella podrá quedarse en su casa y cuidar de sus hijos que aún son pequeños.

loans.use: To purchase clothes & jewelry to sell

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Señora Zunilda is 33 years old and she is married. They have 4 children, two are going to school and the other two are too young to go to school at this time. Zunilda and her husband have a nursery where they sell all sorts of flowers. Their specialty are roses which they have in various colors and sizes. They are very sought after by their clients. Besides roses, they also have carnations, daisies, jasmines and about a couple of months ago they began selling sod.

They have clients from other ciities. Some of these clients come all the way to Caacupe to buy their beautiful flowers. They also sell to the local flower shops. There is one particular flower shop located in Asuncion (capital city located 54 km from the city of Caacupe) which buys from them twice a week. In order to have all the orders ready, they start their day from 3:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon.

They are requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD to purchase seeds, water hoses & fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zunilda, tiene 33 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, los dos más grande van a la escuela y los más pequeños aún no están en edad escolar. Zunilda y su marido tienen un vivero y se dedican a la venta de plantas. Su especialidad son las rosas, que tienen de diferentes colores y tamaños y son los de mayor demanda por sus clientes. Además de las rosas ellos tiene otras flores como claveles, margaritas, jazmines y hace cuestión de unos meses empezaron a vender pasto. Ellos tienen clientes de diferentes ciudades que vienen hasta Caacupé para comprar sus flores, poseen varios clientes fijos como florerías que se abastecen de rosas de su vivero. Dos veces por semana una florería de Asunción (ciudad capital que dista 54 km de la ciudad de Caacupé) hace sus pedidos y para prepararlos ellos empiezan su jornada a las 3 de la mañana y a las 4 vienen a retirarlos. El préstamo que solicita es de $ 200 y los desea invertir en la compra de semillas, mangueras para riegos y abonos.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, water hoses & fertilizer

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is originally from Guadalupe in Nuevo León. For six years he has made and sold tacos. He started his business because he had difficulties finding employment and had to pay rent where he and his roommates lived. He is married with two children. Family effort has been the key to his business's growth since everyone collaborates and now, he has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products.

They started selling the tacos in his home, after buying a trailer to sell his business in a better spot. Currently, he is seeking a loan of $925 to buy tables and chairs, which will allow them to offer better serivice. He promises to repay this loan in 6 months. Be a part of this family's achievments. They sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es originario de la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León, desde hace seis años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tacos, inició su negocio por la dificultad que tuvo para encontrar un empleo y tenía que cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de las colegiaturas, él está casado y tiene dos hijos. La unión familiar ha sido pieza clave en el crecimiento de este negocio, pues todos colaboran para sacarlo adelante y afortunadamente ahora ya cuentan con un buen número de clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos.

Comenzaron vendiendo en su casa, después adquirieron un remolque para vender sus productos en un mejor punto y ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares para la compra de mesas y sillas que le permitirán brindar un mejor servicio, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is a hard-working woman from the town of Apodaca in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is separated and has four children, three of them married and the youngest still studying and in the house. To help the youngest with school expenses so he can continue studying, two years ago Guadalupe started her own business selling shoes. She started selling among neighbors and family, but now has a solid number of clients. Sometimes she has the help of her son, who delivers client orders .

To cover the demand for her shoes and continue offering a good service Guadalupe is applying for a US$ 325 loan. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, and promises to pay the loan back in 4 months. Guadalupe is very grateful for the opportunity that you give her to grow with her business.

Translated by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora, es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León, está separada y tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya casados, sólo el más pequeño aún vive con ella y está estudiando. Para apoyarlo con los gastos de su escuela y que pudiera continuar Guadalupe inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado hace dos años, empezó entre sus vecinos y familiares pero ahora ya tiene un buen número de clientes y en ocasiones cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo para repartir los pedidos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos y ofrecer un buen servicio Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Guadalupe agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her shoe-selling business

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana lives in Guadalupe in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She's is part of a common-law union and has two small daughters, ages 2 and 8. Juana works for a local business but her salary is insufficient to cover all the needs of her children, so a year and a half ago she decided to start her own business selling food, initially hamburgers and roast sausage.

Now, thanks to the growing demand for her product, Juana wants to start selling steak as well and is requesting a loan of $475 to purchase a grill and necessary ingredients. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Juana is very grateful for the opportunity to improve the quality of life for her and her family and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León vive Juana, ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, de 2 y 8 años de edad. Juana trabaja en una empresa de la localidad pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de sus pequeñas, por lo que decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de comidas desde hace año y medio, comenzó vendiendo hamburguesas y salchichas asadas.

Ahora gracias a la creciente demanda que tiene quiere incorporar la venta de carne asada y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares para la compra de una parrilla e insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Juana agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a grill and ingredients

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria is married and has a 17-year-old son and a 13-year-old daughter. Her husband's salary is very small and not enough to pay the bills without extra income. Six years ago, Maria started a business selling cosmetics via catalogue, and soon after incorporated undergarments and found greater success. Now she has also added shoe sales and has continued to see her sales grow. Love for her family and faith in her husband are a daily motivator for her to work harder and improve her business.

To meet her clients' demands and provide them a quality service, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. The well being of this family is in your hands. They are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de la Luz es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad y una hija de 13. El salario que su esposo recibe era muy bajo para solventar los gastos del hogar y ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, desde hace siete años Maria inició su negocio vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, poco después incluyó la venta de blancos y obtuvo mejores resultados, ahora ha incorporado la venta de calzado y continua creciendo con su negocio. El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso que tiene con su esposo la motivan día con día a esforzarse más y a mejorar su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is married and has three children, ages 5, 8 and 16. Her husband has a job in the United States, but it was difficult for him to send money to his family. Still needing to provide for her children, four years ago Martha started her own business selling undergarments and footwear. Little by little, she has stocked her business better and incremented her number of clients. Her youngest daughter helps her with the business, and together they have been able to grow it.

To cover current orders and improve her customer service, Martha is requesting a loan of $425, which she plans to repay within six months. You can help this family improve their quality of life. They are grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 5, 8 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo consiguió un trabajo en Estados Unidos le era difícil mandar dinero a su familia, ante esta necesidad y para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaban sus hijos desde hace cuatro años Martha inició su propio negocio con la venta de blancos y calzado, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio e incrementando su número de clientes, su hija mayor le ayuda en el negocio y juntas han logrado hacerlo crecer.

Con la finalidad de cubrir pedidos que tiene y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece Martha está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo y la confianza que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Simón

texts.es:
Simón is a native of the town of Apodaca in Nuevo León. He is married and has five children. Fourteen years ago Simón opened up his carpentry shop. He began working in his home with very few tools, but fortunately he was able to increase his sales and he constantly was receiving more requests for work. He kept growing and acquiring more specialized tools that allowed him to do jobs of higher quality. Since then he has obtained a rental site to establish his business in a better location and have more clients.
