texts.en: Gulam Abas lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two sons. He is happy. His business has been the only source of income for his family. His sons are in school. He is supporting them. He is a tailor, and he has a small shop. He wants to take a group loan to get a larger shop and expand his business to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Masoma

texts.en: Masoma lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, and she is a widow. Her husband died of cancer 5 years ago. She has a son. She is a very enterprising and responsible woman. She has a carpet weaving shop. She learned this business in Pakistan during the war in Kabul. Now she needs money for her business. She wants to take a group loan to purchase all her materials. She would love to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima, a 25-year-old woman, is married and has a child. She has her own orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her orchard.

loans.use: To buy  pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Shakhanim

texts.en: Shakhanim is 27 years old, married, and has a child. She lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her vine-growing. This young mother of one child has 4 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en: Nazkhanim Mammadov is 55-year-old trader who owns her store where she sells toiletry and makeup products. Nazkhanim is married and has three children. She lives in Imishli region which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. She opened her store in 1996 when she borrowed $800 USD from Aqroinvest CU. She started to sell different sorts of shampoos and soaps. This brought her good income and she returned the money during her paying back period. Nazkhanim retired and her pension is approximately $27-30 USD. Her store is the first income in her family and she is working very hard.  She expanded the products in her store and now she is going to open a food section; for the first time she is going to sell beverages and preserved food. She applied for a loan of $1200 USD.

loans.use: To broaden her store by opening a food section

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh Y. is 23-year-old trader who owns his a food store in the southern Azerbaijani region of Imihsli. Taleh is married and has two children.  He has three years of experience in selling food and beverages. The food stores are in high demand in this region and Taleh decided to purchase a refrigerator for food which needs a cooling system, like meat, yoghurt, and milk, etc. Taleh applied for $1200 USD to purchase one refrigerator.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator to keep food

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Amiraslan

texts.en: Amiraslan N. is 27-year-old farmer who keeps a sheep herd and lives with his wife and two children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Amiraslan is an internally displaced person who fled to Saatli from Nagorniy Karabakh during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He has kept a sheep herd since 2001. From the money he saved, he purchased his first five sheep. He sells mutton to the local and capital bazaar traders. Amiraslan does not have a bachelor degree and his family was too poor too allow him finish high school. Amiraslan started to help his father when he was fifteen. Currently, selling mutton is the only source of revenue in their family. The mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat meat at home and in the cafes. He applied for $1000 USD to purchase 15-16 sheep for estimated cost of $60-70 USD each.

loans.use: To enlarge his sheep herd

loans.name: Mokhbali

texts.en: Mokhbali Q. is 47-year-old farmer who lives in the small village Otuziki, in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Imishli. Mokhbali lives with his wife and three children. Mokhbala has nine years of experience in animal breeding and he has one milk cow and sells milk and yoghurt to the local and capital traders. There is a big competition in dairy products selling and he is working very hard to cover his family needs. Mokhbala is going to purchase an additional cow and a calf.  He purchased his current milk cow two years ago when he borrowed $800 USD from Aqroinvest CU. He successfully paid back his loan and now he is applying for $1000 USD for a second loan. The estimated cost for the cow is $700-800 USD and $200-300 USD for the calf.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad Q. is 35-year-old farmer who owns a sheep herd and lives with his three children and wife in small Otuziki village in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Elshad has seven years of experience in sheep breeding and mutton selling to the local and capital traders. Elhsad`s business going very well because mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat at home and cafes. Elshad decided to expand his business and purchase one milk cow and seven sheep. The estimated cost for cow is $700-800 USD and for one sheep is $60-70 USD.

loans.use: To enlarge his sheep herd and purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin has been an internally displaced person since 1993. He is married and has four children. He opened his business in 1993. He has already received three loans, for $400, $500 and $600 to  open and eventually expand his shop. Currently, he wants to borrow $800 to further expand his business in order to improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Elgiz

texts.en: Elgis is from Imishly region of Azerbaijan. He was born in 1979. He moved to Baku and started a small business on his own. He rents a booth in an underground passage and sells men's shoes. He buys his inventory at Airport market, which is famous for selling shoes wholesale. The business is running well but Elgiz wants to expand it to include shoes for the winter season and increase variety. For this purpose, he applied to Normicro (Baku branch) for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To increase the variety of shoes in his store

loans.name: Fakhriya

texts.en: Fakhriya is an internally displaced person (IDP) as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan conflict. Originally from the Fizuli region, she now lives in a hostel with her husband and one child. She rents a shop in the market and sells various household items but mainly kitchen equipment. She started this business seven years ago with her husband. Before that, they were engaged in different types of small trade. Her current business in developing and she wants to invest more in her business.  She hopes to attract more clients by selling more items. She applied to Normicro (Baku branch) for a loan of $500 as she has little funds of her own.

loans.use: To increase the amount of inventory

loans.name: Cesar Francisco

texts.en:
I have a small grocery stand that I run from my home and I would like to buy more merchandise. I had to close for several days because of health reasons and I have a shortage of many items, but I also lack the money to invest in more merchandise. I am requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase inventory for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio de abarrotes en mi vivienda y me gustarla comprar más mercancía ya que por varios días tuve que cerrar por razones de salud, en realidad me faltan muchas cosas pero me falta dinero para la inversión” Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para comprar mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother to a 7 year old son and a 6 year old daughter. They are the reason she started her own business selling shoes three years ago. She has no one to rely on or help her with her children, so she has to work very hard everyday to get ahead. Fortunately, her knack for sales and her desire to provide for her family have helped her increase the number of customers and expand her business, as this is her only source of income.

She currently needs a loan in the amount of $475, to be repaid over a six month period, to fill current orders and to buy shoes for the new season. This will allow her to provide better service and continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es madre soltera de un pequeño de 7 años de edad y una niña de 6 años, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual hace tres años inició su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos, no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que tiene que esforzarse mucho día con día. Afortunadamente su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de sacar adelante a su familia la han ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer creer su negocio, éste representa la única fuente de ingresos para su familia.

En estos momentos Elena necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que le permitirán surtir los pedidos que tiene y adquirir calzado de la nueva temporada para ofrecer un mejor servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Elena, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, is separated from her husband and has a 13-year old daughter. To provide for her daughter and give her a good education, Maria started a business selling products for the home three years ago. She already holds a full time job, but her salary isn't enough to cover household expenses, so she started this business to supplement her income. She has been able to obtain more customers and increase her sales because she sells high quality products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $475 to buy additional merchandise and continue to provide her customers with good service. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Your assistance and support will help her expand her business and provide a better life for her family, for which Maria thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 43 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene una hija de 13 años. Para sacar adelante a su hija y ofrecerle una buena educación Maria comenzó a vender productos para el hogar desde hace tres años, aunque ella tiene un empleo, su salario es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar e inició este negocio para tener un ingreso extra, la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa le han ayudado a incrementar su número de cliente y sus ventas rápidamente.

Para comprar mercancía y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que te agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nadia Maribel

texts.en:
Nadia is a young mother of two - a 2-year old boy and a 1-year old girl. After her daughter's birth, Nadia needed to increase her income and at the same time, have enough time for her children, so she decided to start her own business selling used clothing. She sells her clothing in makets and makes a living this way. Fortunately, there is great demand for her goods and because she provides great service, her business has grown well.

Nadia needs a loan of $475 to buy additional merchandise for the coming season. She will repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Nadia and her family thank you for your assistance and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Nadia es una joven madre de dos pequeños, un niño de 2 años y una linda niña de 1 año de edad. Desde que nació su hijo Nadia necesitaba tener un mayor ingreso y el tiempo disponible para su pequeño por lo que decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta e ropa usada, ella se instala en los mercados rodante y es de esta manera como puede obtener los recursos que necesita para su familia, afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece y la alta demanda por estos productos le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Nadia está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, para tener surtido de esta nueva temporada y poder incrementar sus ventas, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is originally from Guadalupe in Nuevo Leon, Mexico. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a trash collection company and earns very low wages. When Maria Teresa would bring lunch to her husband at work, his co-workers started asking to buy food from her as well. Because her food is very good, she soon had many paying customers. This is how she started her business four years ago.

Maria Teresa wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $925 which she will use to buy a larger comal - a cast iron grill used to make tortillas and char chiles - to increase her food production, and also tables and chairs to offer better service to her customers. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Your help will go a long way toward helping this family. Maria Teresa and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Teresa es originaria de la localidad de Guadalupe en el estado de Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de recolección de basura y su salario es muy bajo, cuando Maria le llevaba de comer a su esposo en la empresa, los compañeros de trabajo comenzaron a hacerle pedidos y gracias al buen sabor de sus comidas pronto sus clientes se incrementaron, así fue como inició su negocio hace cuatro años.

Ahora Maria quiere continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de un comal más grande que le permita incrementar su producción, así como en la compra de mesas y sillas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio, Maria y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase a table, chairs and a cast iron grill

loans.name: Cristian David

texts.en:
Cristian is a 20-year old young entrepreneur. He married a year ago and started his own business selling ice cream and snacks to cover living expenses. He used to work for a similar company and has used that experience, along with his good service and high quality products, to quickly expand his business. His desire to provide for his family motivates him to work hard each day.

He is requesting a loan of $200, to be repaid over 4 months, to buy additional merchandise for his business. Your support will be instrumental in helping Cristian's business expand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristian tiene 20 años, es un joven emprendedor, hace un año se casó y para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar inició su propio negocio con la venta de helados y snack, anteriormente laboraba en una empresa similar y ahí adquirió la experiencia que le ha permitido crecer rápidamente, ofreciendo un muy buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad. El deseo de contar con un patrimonio para sus futuros hijos, lo motiva a esforzarse más cada día.

Para surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes Cristian está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete y apoya a Cristian.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juan José

texts.en:
Juan Jose is married and has three children - 7 and 14 year old girls and a 5 year old boy. They are originally from Linares, In Nuevo Leon, Mexico. Juan didn't get an opportunity to finish school; he attended elementary school and then went to work as an apprentice bricklayer while still a young boy. With his experience and high quality work, he has been able to make progress as a small business owner and was able to buy better tools. He also started renting scaffolding and lately has begun selling furniture.

His desire to provide for his family and his wish that his children finish school motivate him to work hard each day. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 to buy wood and furniture to supply his business. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Juan Jose and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan José está casado y tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres de 7 y 14 años de edad y un pequeño de 5, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León. Juan no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar estudiando, solo terminó su educación primaria y comenzó a trabajar como ayudante de albañil desde muy pequeño. Con la experiencia que tiene ahora realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad, gracias a su esfuerzo logró progresar como microempresario y empezó a adquirir herramienta más especializada, también renta madera, andamios, y últimamente comenzó a vender muebles para el hogar.

El deseo de salir adelante con su familia y que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios lo impulsan a mejorar cada día, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de madera y muebles para darle impulso a su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a ayudarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase tools and merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe Argelia

texts.es:
Guadalupe started her business four years ago. She is married and has two children. One of them is 13 and the other one 20 years old. They both go to school. Her husband is a bus chofer. However, his salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses. Therefore, Guadalupe, being an entrepreneurial woman, started selling candy, soda and appetizers from her home. The sales soon started to increase and, per her clients' request, she started selling other products.

Guadalupe wishes to continue growing. Therefore, she requests a $250.00 dollar loan which she commits to return in 5 months. She hopes to better supply her business and cover her clients' needs. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands. They need and thank all the trust and support you put into their business.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman. Kiva Volunteer.

Hace cuatro años Guadalupe inició su propio negocio, elL. es casada y tiene dos hijos, D. 13 y 20 años D. edad, ambos estudian y su esposo es chofer D. autobuses, pero con su salario no pueden cubrir todos los gastos D. su familia, por lo que Guadalupe siendo una mujer emprendedora empezó a vender dulces, refrescos y botanas en su casa, pronto fue incrementando sus ventas y a petición D. sus clientes fue incorporando L. venta D. abarrotes.

Guadalupe desea continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un préstamo D. $ 250 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses, con lo que espera surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes. En tus manos esta el bienestar D. esta familia, ellos necesitan y agradecen mucho L. confianza y apoyo que depositas en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is one of the young ladies that join SPBD last year. Her business is making handicrafts such as earrings for the ladies, bracelets, hair accessories and picture frames already designed with different styles. Foketi sells her products at the flea market at Fugalei, which is preferable because more income can be earned here than anywhere else. She started last year with a loan of $750 and now she is on her second loan of $1250. She sells her products throughout the week opening seven days from six o’clock in the morning to five o’clock in the evening earning $800 a day. After deducting all her expenses, she earns about four hundred to five hundred profit a day and about two thousand to two thousand and eighty tala a week. She is looking forward to supply more in the following week of the South Pacific Games.

loans.use: “Buy frames, paints, materials, x-saw and kofi for the carving”

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria is married and has 4 children. She is a member of the Divino Amparo association of Pro Mujer. Her main line of business is selling cosmetics and costume jewelry in the main markets of the city of El Alto. She started out as an artisan, weaving woolen items, but this activity was not very profitable. She currently has six stalls which she opens only on market days.

She needs this loan to buy a selection of perfumes to add to her merchandise mix, as this is a very profitable line of business which will allow her to quickly increase her income and will result in better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

María M. de Arazaca Casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Divino Amparo de Pro Mujer. Se dedica principalmente a la venta de cosméticos y bisutería en las principales ferias de la ciudad del Alto. Comenzó en Pro Mujer como artesana, tejiendo prendas en lana, pero esta era una actividad muy sacrificada que además no era redituable. En la actualidad María es dueña de 6 puestos de venta los cuales abre solo en días de feria. Ella precisa de capital para poder incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de perfumes, actividad mucho mas redituable y que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos de forma mas rápida y ayudarla a mejorar sus condiciones de vida

loans.use: To purchase perfumes for resale

loans.name: Ilsem

texts.es:
Ilsem D. Conde has a one year old child. She sells cosmetics at the Lanza's Market in the city of La Paz.Two years ago, for different reasons, mainly economical, she had no choice but to rent her selling spot to her aunt - who currently collaborates with her nephews.

Ilsem needs money to be able to own her own business and start selling cosmetics with more will and power - since his son has more and more needs to be satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilsem D. Conde Madre de 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en el Mercado Lanza de la ciudad de La Paz. Por diferentes motivos, principalmente económicas se vio obligada a dar en alquiler el puesto de venta a su tía, la cual hace dos años administra y colabora a sus sobrinos.. Ilsem precisa de dinero para poder tener su negocio y emprender con mas fuerza la venta de cosméticos, en vista de que su hijo cada vez tiene más necesidades que deben ser satisfechas.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria is married and has two children. She is a member of the Divino Amparo association of Pro Mujer. Her line of business is the sale of food items wholesale, mainly to small business owners in the area. Her sales are on credit, meaning that she delivers the merchandise and collects payment after a pre-determined time period. After getting payment, she then begins a new sales cycle. She considers herself a wholesaler. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has been able to buy a small lot where she hopes to build a modest home.

Maria needs this loan to buy additional merchandise; she has proved that her business is not only viable but also profitable and will allow her to one day realize her dream of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

María L. Chipana pertenece a la asociación Divino Amparo de Pro Mujer, casada y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de víveres al por mayor, principalmente a comerciantes de la ceja del alto, su sistema de venta es el crédito, es decir deja sus productos por un determinado tiempo y luego cobra para nuevamente iniciar un nuevo ciclo de venta. Se considera mayorista y gracias a su esforzado trabajo consiguió la compra de un pequeño terreno donde piensa iniciar la construcción de su casa.

María necesita de más capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, y ha quedado demostrando que su negocio es prospero. Así logrará el sueño de iniciar las obras de construcción de su casa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tauese

texts.en:
Tauese P. is the mother of seven kids. Most of her children are in school. Her husband is unemployed, and she is the only breadwinner in the family.
She is a good tailor and , and wants to purchase another sewing machine. She has been involved in the South Pacific Business Programme for unemployed women for some time now and used her first loan of $750.00 to purchase a sewing machine. She is now on her 6th loan of $3000ST which was used for home improvements and to help purchase equipment and agricultural chemicals for her husbands’ plantation, which also helps her in her loan repayments. She is very thankful and proud of her involvement in the program.

loans.use: Business expansion & home improvement

loans.name: Lucía

texts.en:
Lucia holds the office of association secretary with Pro Mujer. She has been with this organization for 10 years. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she also sells accessories, such as purses and backpacks, which she makes herself. She has had this business for 5 years. Initially she made these items in small quantities, but even after investing in more materials and supplies, her sales still didn't generate enough income.

Lucia is requesting this loan to allow her to continue expanding her business and add a book shop at the same location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia P. Quispe Ella es secretaria de actas de la asociación Escuelitas 2 de Pro Mujer, además cuenta una antigüedad de 10 años en la organización. A la fecha es dueña de una tienda de víveres, donde también vende accesorios de vestir, como ser carteras mochilas y otros que ella misma confecciona, ambas actividades las desarrolla hace mas de 5 años. En principio Lucia confeccionaba en poca cantidad, lo que la llevó a invertir en material e insumos, pero aún esto no generaba los ingresos suficientes. En la actualidad Lucia ya es dueña de un almacén y precisa de mayor capital para poder ampliar su negocio y lograr la apertura de una librería.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra C., married and mother of three children, has been a member of the association Kantutitas of Pro Mujer for 12 years. She lives in Anticrético in the city of El Alto and is devoted to the organization of games with cumulative money prizes (called “Pasanaco”); at the same time, she gives out loans at low interest rates. Unfortunately, her husband´s salary as a public employee is not enough to make a living for the family, so she needs capital to continue her activities, which generate sufficient income for sustenance and to satisfy her children´s requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra C., casada y madre de tres hijos, es miembro de la asociación Kantutitas de Pro Mujer, con una antigüedad de 12 años. Vive en Anticrético en la ciudad de El Alto y se dedica principalmente a la organización de juegos, con pozos de dinero acumulable (Pasanaco); al mismo tiempo se dedica a los préstamos de dinero a bajos intereses. Lastimosamente, el sueldo de empleado público que percibe su esposo no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, por lo que ella precisa de capital para continuar en su actividad, que le genera los ingresos necesarios para subsistir y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.

loans.use: She needs capital to continue her activities, which generate sufficient income to survive and satisfy her children´s requirements.

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en: Asiasiga is 42 years of age and has 8 children. She is known for being an excellent  tailor and makes all the uniforms for the school and the village church choirs uniforms. She started her business with a loan of $750ST and is now on her 4th loan of $1250ST.  The loans have been used to expand her business, to purchase a new sewing machine and to help pay her kids' school fees. She is very happy to continue on this program and is looking forward to receiving another loan so that she can improve her house.

loans.use: Business expansion and education

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladys is 26 years old and was married just 6 months ago. She has been a member of Pro Mujer in the city of El Alto for several years. She started out with a small loan of about $100, which allowed her to buy small quantities of goods to stock her small grocery stand. Over the years she was able to secure larger loans, which have allowed her to get to the point today where she is able to open a well-stocked grocery store in a commercial space.

Today Gladys lives with her brand new husband in a small apartment in the Cosmos 79 area. Her plan is to find a store to rent in a commercial area of El Alto that will guarantee a higher income for the couple.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys M. de Torrez , tiene 26 años y esta casada hace 6 meses, pertenece a la asociación Rocío de la Mañana de Pro Mujer del Centro Focal de Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto. En sus inicios como socia, Gladys consiguió un pequeño crédito de aproximadamente 100 $us, con lo que inicio su negocio, comprando víveres por unidades y tratando de abastecer su tienda. Con el paso de los años y continuando en los ciclos de la organización, ella logra acceder a créditos algo más grandes con lo que por fin consolida la apertura de un almacén bien surtido.

Actualmente Gladys vive junto a su flamante esposo, en un pequeño departamento en la Zona de Cosmos 79, y su intención es conseguir una tienda en Anticrético por la ceja de El Alto, zona netamente comercial y que garantiza un mayor ingreso para ella y su pareja.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Married and mother of five children, Bertha C. de Layme is the owner of a grocery store located in her home, in the region of Cosmos 79 of El Alto city. She belongs to the association “Rocío de la Mañana” of Pro Mujer, being one of the newest members, with only two years in the organization. She has been devoted to this business for four years and started it thanks to the collaboration of her son, who works as a public transportation driver. Her husband’s salary as a policeman and public service person is not enough. Bertha needs the capital to enlarge her store and incorporate a bookstore and a photocopy center, since the grocery store is only enough to cover her basic needs but not to venture into another business.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada y madre de cinco hijos, Bertha C. de Layme es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propio domicilio, en la zona de Cosmos 79 en la ciudad de El Alto. Pertenece a la asociación Rocío de la Mañana de Pro Mujer, siendo una de las socias más nuevas, con tan solo dos años de permanencia en la organización. Hace 4 años ella se dedica a esta actividad, que logró establecer gracias a la colaboración de su hijo, quien trabaja como chofer de transporte público. El sueldo del esposo no es suficiente, por tratarse de un policía y servidor público. Bertha precisa de capital para poder ampliar su tienda con el fin de abrir una librería y una central de fotocopias, porque a la fecha el almacén solo le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, pero no así para incursionar en otro negocio.

loans.use: Bertha needs the capital to enlarge her store and incorporate a bookstore and a photocopy center, since the grocery store is only enough to cover her basic needs but not to venture into another business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina C. Condori is a divorced mother of three who belongs to the February 2nd Association of Villa Adela where she serves as Treasurer. The association has been around for 10 years and is one of the precursors.

Her main activity is the sale of fast food, such as hamburgers and salchipapas (a combination of hotdogs and french-fries) among other items. She sells these items at her kiosk which she obtained thanks to credit from ProMujer. Before this she worked as a cook in a restaurant where she was paid very little and was unable to care for her children and her family because of the time she had to invest in her job.

Marina requires money so that she may be able to buy some land and, in addition to building a house, create an environment within which she can open her own restaurant. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life for all of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina C. Condori, es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos, pertenece a la Asociación 2 de Febrero de Villa Adela, donde cumple funciones de Tesorera de dicha asociación. tiene una antigüedad de diez años, y es una de las precursoras.

Su principal actividad es la venta de comida rápida, como ser hamburguesas, salchipapas y otros. en la actualidad cuenta con un Kiosco de venta propio, que logró adquirir gracias a los créditos de Pro Mujer, ya que antes de esta actividad, ella trabajaba como cocinera en una pensión (restaurante), donde le pagaban muy poco y por el tiempo invertido descuidaba la atención de sus hijos y su familia.

Marina precisa de capital para poder comprar un terreno y construir además de su vivienda un ambiente que le permita abrir su propia pensión, de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus seres queridos.

loans.use: Marina requires money so that she may be able to buy some land and, in addition to building a house, create an environment within which she can open her own restaurant. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life for all of her loved ones.

loans.name: Tiupi

texts.en: Mrs B. is married with 8 children. She is a good cooker and that is why she chose the BBQ, which is easy, as her starting business, to used her 1st loan of $750ST.She’s happy that she can get financial help to run the business and also assist her with raising her 8 kids. And she believed that she would stay longer in the program, that’s because she need some help for her children’s school fees. She is looking forward to get another loan to build a special place to sell the barbeque foods and maintain the quality of her business.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is one of the young ladies that join SPBD last year. Her business is making handicrafts such as earrings for the ladies, bracelets, hair accessories and picture frames already designed with different styles. Foketi sells her products at the flea market at Fugalei, which is preferable because more income can be earned here than anywhere else. She started last year with a loan of $750 and now she is on her second loan of $1250. She sells her products throughout the week opening seven days from six o’clock in the morning to five o’clock in the evening earning $800 a day. After deducting all her expenses, she earns about four hundred to five hundred profit a day and about two thousand to two thousand and eighty tala a week. She is looking forward to supply more in the following week of the South Pacific Games.

loans.use: “Buy frames, paints, materials, x-saw and kofi for the carving”

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery Mamani Torrez, is a member of the Rocío de la Mañana Association from Villa Adela, in the city of El Alto and she works as a Secretary of Acts for this association. Married and mother of two children, Mery dedicates her work to manufacturing and selling children’s clothing, dresses and jackets, products that she will start to sell early in the morning in different fairs. With the purpose of earning more profits, Mery travels regularly to Desaguadero, a location where she has a set clientele that buys her products. Her tailoring and clothing workshop has been operating for the last five years and was inherited from her family, from whom she learned her profession. Currently, she owns a thriving workshop that she administers along with her husband and they have all the machinery necessary for this activity. Mery requires capital in order to penetrate the tailoring and manufacturing of jeans, which generates more profits, but at the same time requires a solid investment.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer

Mery Mamani Torrez, pertenece a la Asociación Rocío de la Mañana de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto, cumpliendo funciones de Secretaria de Actas de dicha asociación. Casada, y madre de dos hijos, Mery se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa para niños, vestidos y chamarras, los que comercializa muy temprano en la mañana en diferentes ferias. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos, Mery viaja constantemente a la localidad de Desaguadero, donde ya cuenta con clientela fija que compra sus productos. Su taller de costura y confección funciona hace 5 años, fue heredado de su familia, de quienes aprendió el oficio. En la actualidad cuenta con un prospero taller que administra al lado de su esposo, y cuentan con maquinaria necesaria para esta actividad. Mery precisa de capital para poder incursionar en la costura y confección de jeans, producto que genera muchas más ganancias, pero que al mismo tiempo requiere de una fuerte inversión.

loans.use: Mery requires capital in order to penetrate the tailoring and manufacturing of jeans, which generates more profits, but at the same time requires a solid investment.

loans.name: Maeva

texts.en: Maeva G. is one of the new ladies joining the  programme. This is her second loan of $1250 and this is a very busy time for Maeva especially the South Pacific Games on the way here  in Samoa. Instead of opening her shop in front of her own house, Maeva rents one of the stores at Fugalei Market which is more profitable because it offers more customers than in the village. She opens six days of the week from six in the morning to five o’clock in the evening. Maeva’s husband is in New Zealand and he sends about five hundred fortnightly to Maeva for the shop. They have no children and Maeva is focusing on improving her business so that she can get more in the weeks of the South Pacific Games.

loans.use: Buy two boxes of mutton flaps, chicken legs, mosquito coils, cartoon of cigarettes, and other stuff for the shop.”

loans.name: Karanga

texts.en: Karanga S. is a meat and smoked cow skin salesman at the market of Port-Bouët, in the south of the Abidjan District. He is 30 years old and is married. Karanga has 2 children with his housewife Adjaratou. He has been doing this business since 1997. He joined AE&I microcredit program in February 2005. Karanga will use the loan  to purchase a cow, increase his business volume, and improve his margin. Karanga's 6-year-old daughter (the oldest) will start primary school in September 2007. This will increase the family's living expenses. Karanga wants to better develop his micro-business in order to meet the financial responsibilities of his house.

loans.use: Karanga Seni will use the loan to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Adjé Ernestine is single mother and has 6 years of work experience in selling spices. She is living with 2 of her 3 brothers and has to take care of them. Thanks to God the last one is mechanic and can get alone. Every new academic year, she has to face education charges. Her father retired and went to live with their mother in the village, where they think life is easier than in the Abidjan district. She needs to increase her micro business revenues to triumph over all that duties and life expenses. Ernestine joined AE&I microcredit program on March 2006 when she heard about the program from her sister.  She is a good performer.

loans.use: Adjé Ernestine will use the loan to purchase palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is one of the owners of the Fugalei Flea Market. She sells earrings, bracelets, Samoan necklaces, ladies handbags and picture frames for family pictures. She is a hard working lady of thirty-eight years. Her first loan is nearly paid off and she is now looking forward to getting another loan to further improve her business. She opens six days a week, and her sales vary from $1000-$1500 a week. The net profit after all her expenses is betwen $500-$800 a week. She wants to take advantage of extra revenue that she can genearate from tourists visitng the SPG Games in Samoa.

loans.use: To buy hooks, chains, paints, afa and timber for frames

loans.name: Naite

texts.en: Naite is a mother of six children. Her husband and herself are never careless in taking care of  their school fees and fares. So being a responsible mother, Naite does not rely on others for that. She is always in attendance whenever there is a seminar being held outside the village and there she gains knowledge and skill to operate a business. She sells her products at the Flea Market at Savalalo and she opens six days a week. Her sales amounts up to $1600 and earns a profit of $800 a week. She is looking forward to expand her business in producing more of the goods that earns her more profit.

loans.use: : “Buy hooks, paints, chains, materials for designing hand bags, and niddles for sewing Samoan caps for protection from the sun.”

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa is a mother of 30 years, with three children. Two of them are girls and one boy. She provides support for her husband who works very hard at their plantation. Elenoa is responsible in selling 2-3 bags of taro twice a week at the New Market and earns $200.00-$300.00.

loans.use: To buy chemicals fertilizers, knives

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Leaving school at a young age did not discourage her to operate a business. She hails from the village of Falelatai, married with three kids. Faapaia operates a Flea Market business selling handicrafts. She just joined the Program last month when she needed help for her business. She earns $150.00-$200.00 per day

loans.use: To buy more stuff for flea market

loans.name: Fiapule

texts.en: Fiapule is a strong woman and the mother of three children.  She and her family live in Siumu B centre. She is a former employee of a privately owned pharmacy in Apia but had to resign as she had nobody to look after her children while she worked.  She now works from home and helps her husband with their plantation to earn extra money to cover their everyday expenses and to help out with the kids’ school activities. Selling taro from the plantation earns her more money than she earned working full time. She delivers 2-3 bags of taro once a week to the market and now gets between $250.00 - $300.00 per trip.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Luatasi

texts.en: Luatasi is a married mother of three children. Her husband has a job but she doesn’t want to continue to rely on his wages because it hardly covers all of their daily needs. Therefore she decided to try out her hand in operating a flea market business to help bring in more money for the family. Now daily, she earns more than $250.00 from sales and has smartly saved most of her profits earned to fall on when in need.

loans.use: To buy more stuff for her business

loans.name: Luavalu

texts.en: Luavalu runs a flea market business selling handicrafts which most of them are woven by her. She is married with 4 kids and hails from the village of Taufusi. She also buy other handicrafts from women in the rural area because it gives her stall more variety for customers to select from. She just joined the Program last month when she needed help for her business. She spends most of her time at her flea market because she believes that selling handicrafts helps her family very much.

loans.use: To buy more stuff for flea market

loans.name: Makalita

texts.en: Makalita is married to a farmer from the village of Siumu, quite far from town. He is unemployed and she was looking around for ways to earn money to support her children toher than depending on her husband’s farming skills to bring in food for the family. When she got word about SPBD Program and how it has managed to help women that were in the same situation, she decided to give it a try. She got a loan out of the program and invested it into their plantation giving her husband encouragement to work harder while she sells their products at the market. She delivers 2-3 bags of taro to the market once a week and she gets $250.00-$300.00. This money is being used to support her family witheir daily needs and her taro plantaion.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, knives fertilizers

loans.name: Mulimai

texts.en:
Mulimai is a married and has two children.  She lives in the village of Siuniu and earns money from working her husband's plantation.
She joined the loan program in 2005 when she needed help to set up her plantation. She is now into paying off her third loan of $1750.00. She sells 3-4 bags of taro at Fugalei Market twice a month which earns her between $600.00 and $800.00 per month .

loans.use: To purchase chemicals & tools and equipment to upgrade her plantation

loans.name: Toaiva

texts.en: Toaiva Faaulufalega has three children. She is married to a Siumu farmer and helps him with their taro plantation to bring in money for the family. She also gets support from her brothers. She is now trying her best to pay off her second loan of $1250.000 and to apply for another loan of $1750.00 to purchase more chemicals, tools and fertilizers, so that she does not have to continue to rely heavily on her her family's earnings.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Tootoo

texts.en: “ I love being a business woman. It is not only a privelage but a blessing as well.” Tootoo is not only a mother with six children but also a vegetable farmer. Her husband is a farmer from the village of Siumu and supports her a lot in her Vegetable Garden.  She sells her vegetables just in front of her house and delivers to the market to be sold twice a week. She earns $250.00-$300.00 and uses this money to support her family and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds and gardening tools

loans.name: Hanu

texts.fr:
At 43 years of age, Mrs. Hanu A. is the fourth wife of her husband. Seven children among the 21 her husband has in total are hers. Each wife takes care of the daily needs and education of her own children. The husband, feeling crushed by the burden of his huge family's needs, has been driven to escape his responsibilities for them.

Hanu's primary financial source of revenue is agriculture, more precisely growing sugar cane--a very difficult job because of the manual labor involved in its cultivation.

In view of the importance of this source of income for Hanu, she would like to enlarge her fields and increase her production. To that end, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 in order to hire some help and procure agricultural inputs (fertilizer, etc.) This will allow her to increase her revenue and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 43 ans, Madame A. Hanu est la 4ème femme de son mari. Elle a sept (7) enfants sur les 21 de son mari. Chaque femme s’occupe des besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et de leur éducation. L’homme écrasé par le poids des charges de sa famille est obligé de fuir ses responsabilités.

Madame A. Hanu a comme principale source de revenu l’agriculture et particulièrement la culture de la canne à sucre. Un travail très difficile à cause de son caractère manuel.

Vu l’importance du revenu que cette activité lui procure, elle désire agrandir le champ et améliorer son rendement. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin de s’attacher le service des métayers et des intrants agricoles. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue d’une bonne amélioration de conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: increasing production of sugar cane so as to improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
One of the main sources of revenue for Mrs. Yawa A. has been the sale of “gari” (manioc flour). At 45 years of age, Yawa is married and mother of five children. She is also responsible for caring for the six children of her co-spouse (another of her husband’s wives) who is deceased.

In view of this unusually difficult situation, none of the children has really been enrolled in school. The girls have been married off young and the boys are in apprenticeships. Even managing to supply daily meals is difficult for Yawa, who has at present no way to purchase manioc to transform into gari, and thus no income.

In order to try to remedy this dire situation, Yawa is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will allow her to plant a field of manioc. Part of this field’s yield will be sold and the other part turned into gari, a staple of the Togolese diet. Yawa has the advantage of having a good deal of experience in her chosen work, which should prove a trump card in assuring the success of her endeavor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

L’une des principales sources de revenu de Madame A. Yawa est la vente du gari, (farine à base du manioc). Agée de 45 ans elle mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Outre ses propres enfants, elle prend en charge les six (6) enfants de sa coépouse décédée.

Face à cette situation, aucun des enfants n’a réellement été scolarisé. Les filles précocement mariées et les garçons sont en apprentissage. Le repas quotidien est assuré difficilement. Elle n’a plus de moyen pour s’acheter du manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente de gari.

Face à cette situation, Madame A. Yawa sollicite un crédit de $800 pour faire un champ de manioc. Une partie de ce champ sera destiné à la vente et l’autre partie à la fabrication du gari. L’expérience dont dispose Madame A. est un atout pour le succès de cette activité.

loans.use: plant a field of manioc to use to make manioc flour to sell

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lưu Thị Chiên lives in the village of Hưng Đạo, district Hưng Nguyên. A retiree 10 years ago but she did not just stay home and collect pension from the government. All her five children are grown up and they would like very much help their parents financially but Mrs Chiên does not want to depend on her children. This is why she had contracted a loan from "Quỹ Tình thương" organization 10 years ago. With an small initial loan of only 50 USD, she invested in a small store selling basic goods. Her inventory includes cooking oil, sugar, instant noodle cups ...etc. This not only generates income for her but also provides her a sense of personal satisfaction knowing that she can take care of her self. With the full support from her husband, also a retiree, Mrs Chiên requests a loan of 200 USD to buy more stock for her store which will in term increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Sau khi về hưu, chị Lưu Thị Chiên, xã Hưng Đạo, huyện Hưng Nguyên không chấp nhận việc chỉ ngồi nhận những đồng lương hưu của nhà nước. Mặc dù các con chị, gồm 4 gái và một trai đều đã trưởng thành và luôn mong muốn được giúp đỡ cha mẹ nhưng chị không muốn phụ thuộc vào con cái. Đó là lý do vì sao chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ 10 năm trước. Với số vốn được vay ban đầu là 50 USD, chị đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Cửa hàng nhỏ bao gồm những món hàng như cân đường, chai dầu ăn, gói mì chính vừa tạo ra một khoản thu nhập vừa làm chị cảm thấy vui khi thấy mình vẫn còn đủ sức làm việc. Với sự hỗ trợ, động viên của chồng cũng là một cán bộ nghỉ hưu, chị đang xin vay thêm 200 USD để mua thêm hàng, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 55 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter at Hung Dao Commune, Hung Nguyen District, of Nghe An province. Four of her older children (2 boys and 2 girls) are working away from home and rarely visit, leaving her to take care of the family and all the housework on her own. Mrs. T. starts loaning money in 1998 with the starting amount of $50 to invest in her butchery business. After her four children grew up and left home, without any one to help out, she had to change to fish-farming and raising pigs. Her husband, Mr. Tran Minh Quy, is a disable war veteran but has helped her a lot in both of these businesses. On average, for every farrow of pig she sells (usually once in every 3 months) she earns a profit of $150. Currently, Mrs T. is asking for a loan of $825 to invest in her home projects. This amount of money will be used to buy breeding fish (for $312), breeding pig (for $200) and foodstuff for them (for $312).

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 55 tuổi sống cùng với chồng và cô con gái nuôi tại xã Hưng Đạo, huyện Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. 4 người con lớn gồm 2 trai, 2 gái đều đi làm ăn xa ít có dịp về thăm cha mẹ, chị Tuyết một mình chăm lo hầu hết công việc trong gia đình. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vay vốn từ năm 1998 với mức vốn 50 USD đầu tư cho việc mua thịt lợn bán, nhưng sau khi các con đi làm xa không có người phụ giúp, chị Tuyết chuyển sang chăn nuôi cá và lợn giống. Chồng chị, anh Trần Minh Quý, một thương bệnh binh là người phụ giúp chị rất tích cực trong công việc trông nom ao cá và đàn lợn. Tính bình quân cứ sau khi bán một lứa lợn ( 3 tháng ) chị Tuyết thu lãi khoảng 150 USD. Hiện nay chị Tuyết đang làm dự án xin vay 825 USD để đầu tư cho dự án của mình. Số tiền này được chị tính toán chi tiêu như sau: 312 USD mua cá giống, 200 USD mua lợn giống, 312 USD dùng để mua thức ăn.

loans.use: buy breeding pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi S., 57 years old, currently lives with her husband and 5 children at Hung Nguyen district of Nghe An province. Of her 5 children, only two are going to school, while one is disable. To be able to make ends meet, Mrs. S. has to do all sorts of works, ranging from farming, loaning thresher and harrow machine service, to fish-farming. Though very busy with all these jobs, she still finds time to get involve in welfare works. Currently, she is the chairman of the women association as well as the head of district 17, branch 6 of the TYM Fund. Mrs. S. has had a long history of loaning money to raise pigs but the recent livestock and poultry epidemic diseases have forced her to change to rent out room for weddings. On average, each month she earns a profit of $75 from this service. Now, she is asking to borrow $250 more to buy tables, chairs, bowls and chopsticks for the service usages.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Năm nay 47 tuổi, chị Phạm Thị S. sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại huyện Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Trong số 5 người con của chị thì hai còn đang đi học, một bị tàn tật. Để có thu nhập nuôi sống gia đình chị S. đã làm đủ loại công việc: làm ruộng, dịch vụ máy tuốt lúa, máy bừa, ao cá. Mặc dù bận rộn vất vả làm kinh tế nhưng chị cũng là người rất tích cực tham gia công tác xã hội. Chị hiện vừa đảm nhận công việc của một chi hội trưởng phụ nữ thôn vừa là cụm trưởng cụm 17, chi nhánh 6 Quỹ Tình thương. Đã có một thời gian dài vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn nhưng hiện nay khi xuất hiện dịch bệnh ở gia súc, gia cầm chị đã chuyển sang dịch vụ cho thuê phông rạp làm đám cưới. Trung bình một tháng chị thu lãi khoảng 75 USD từ dịch vụ này. Hiện nay chị đang xin vay thêm 250 USD để mua thêm bàn ghế, bát đũa nhằm phát triển dịch vụ của mình.

loans.use: buy tables, chairs, bowls and chopsticks for hire

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. lives with three children in district Nghi Loc, province Nghe An. Her husband, Mr. Hoang Van Chiem, and their oldest son work away from home as construction workers. They only visit home once a month. In order to raise her three kids, Mrs. M. works really hard on her 1.4-acre field of rice and peanut and breeds pigs and poultry. During the first year joining the Fund, she borrowed $200 to buy pigs and poultry. From this, she earned an average of $20-30 per month. Encouraged by the initial success, she continued to borrow money to develop her business. Unfortunately, her youngest son got in an accident. All the savings from M.’s project as well as the family income is used for the hospital and medicine bills. Although facing a lot of difficulties, Mrs. M. still believes in a bright future. Now her youngest son has just been able to walk again. M. hopes that in 10 years, by the time she is 60, all of her children would be well-educated and each would have a good job. Mr.s M. wants to borrow $500 to buy more pigs to expand her project, bringing more income to her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Mười sống cùng ba con tại huyện Nghi Lộc, tỉnh Nghệ An. Chồng chị, anh Hoàng Văn Chiêm, cùng con trai đầu đi làm thợ xây mỗi tháng mới về nhà một lần. Để nuôi 3 con ăn học, ngoài 1, 4 mẫu đất trồng lúa và lạc, chị Mười còn tích cực đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Năm đầu tiên vào Quỹ, chị vay 200 USD để mua lợn, gà, vịt. Sau năm đầu khoản đầu tư này mang lại cho gia đình trung bình mỗi tháng 20 - 30 USD. Được khích lệ bởi thành công bước đầu chị tiếp tục vay vốn để phát triển dự án. Nhưng không may, con trai thứ 3 của gia đình chị bị tai nạn. Toàn bộ số tiền lãi từ dự án cũng như lương của hai bố con anh đi làm thuê đều chi tiêu hết vào việc thuốc thang, viện phí. Tuy gặp khó khăn nhưng chị Mười vẫn luôn tin tưởng vào tương lai. Hiện tại con trai chị đã có thể đi lại được. Chị Mười mong 10 năm nữa khi 60 tuổi các con chị đều học hành tử tế có công ăn việc làm. Cộng với số gà vịt hiện tại, chị đang làm đơn vay vốn 500 USD để mua thêm vài con lợn cho dự án tăng thu nhập của mình.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Houdzeko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houdzeko T., 38, is the mother of seven of the children of a polygamous marriage. She manages to earn her living through selling groceries on a small scale. Unfortunately, she often confronts the problem of having certain items run out because she cannot afford to reorder quickly enough; thus her customers’ needs may go unmet and she risks losing her clientele.

In order to be able to satisfy their needs, T. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will serve as capital for wholesale purchase of grocery items that she can then stock and resell. The success of this venture will do much to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 38 ans, Madame T. Houdzeko est mère de sept (7) enfants dans une famille polygame. Elle fait essentiellement le commerce des produits vivriers qui lui procure assez de revenus. Malheureusement, elle est très souvent confrontée au problème de rupture de stock à cause du manque des moyens financiers surtout et les commandes de clients ne sont pas satisfaites.

Pour faire face aux besoins exprimés par sa clientèle, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat en gros, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. Le succès de cette activité permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: wholesale purchase, stocking and resale of grocery items

loans.name: Koffi Basile

texts.fr:
Mr. Basile Koffi A. was born in Gapé (Préfecture of Zio, Togo) in 1963. Coming from a poor family, he was not able to attend school. He is married and father of eight children. Besides his agricultural pursuits, he tends a small flock of goats and chickens. His financial situation does not permit him to build stalls or henhouses or install drinking troughs and mangers, etc. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to expand his micro-business of small-animal raising. Improving conditions for his animals will permit him to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koffi Basile est né à Gapé (Préfecture du Zio) en 1963. Issu d’une famille pauvre, il n’avait pas eu la chance pour s’instruire. Marié, il est père de huit (8) enfants. En plus de l’agriculture, il entretient un petit élevage de petits ruminants et de volailles. Ainsi, ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de faire face aux besoins de constructions de paillote, de bergerie, de se doter des abreuvoirs, mangeoires et divers. Il sollicite un appui financier de $1000. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera à son plein épanouissement et à celui de sa famille.

loans.use: Fo Koffi

loans.name: Gulesmer

texts.en:
In the picture you can see Gulesmer with her husband. Gulesmer is a mother of 5 children. She lives in Khachmaz town, is 54 years old, and has been farming for 6 years.

She has her own orchard where she grows fruit trees and vegetables.
Now  she needs a loan of $725  to buy fertilizer and pesticides  so she can improve her business and harvest more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born on December 31, 1969 in Gapé, Togo. She is married and mother of 10 children. Her ne’er-do-well husband is drives a motorcycle taxi but scarcely manages to support his family. Born into a poor family, Mrs. A. began early with the business of preparing beans and gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple food) for sale. This is her main business undertaking and she works hard at it in spite of her meager resources.

A. would like to expand her micro-business, but she does not have the necessary capital to do so. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 600 which will allow her to build a shed and to purchase raw materials for her production of basic staples for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akossiwa est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Gapé. Elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Son mari malafoutier et conducteur de taxi moto arrive difficilement à supporter sa famille. Issue d’une famille pauvre, Madame A. Akossiwa s’est adonnée très tôt à la préparation et à la vente du haricot et gari. Cette activité est la toute première qu’elle exerce avec bravoure malgré son infirmité.

Elle cherche aujourd’hui à renforcer cette activité mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $600 qui va lui servir de construction d’un hangar, à l’approvisionnement des matières premières pour la préparation et la vente du haricots.

loans.use: build a shed and buy raw materials for her staple food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock for his inventory

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is 56 years old and married. He has three children and lives in Khachmaz town. 3 years ago , he started his business. He sells agricultural produce: tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages,etc. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more agricultural produce so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1971 in Gapé, Togo, Mrs. Adjo B. is a seamstress. Married to a farmer who has difficulty supporting the family, she manages daily to come up with her share of financial input for their family’s needs.

Adjo is illiterate since she lacked the financial means to attend school. Instead, she became an apprentice. At the end of her apprenticeship and in view of her rather difficult situation, she has been obliged to rent a sewing machine to use in order to practice her trade.

With all this in mind, Adjo is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which she plans to use to buy a sewing machine and set up a workshop where she can do her work in proper fashion. This will allow her to improve her socio-economic condition and live life more fully.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1971 à Gapé, Madame B. Adjo est couturière. Mariée à un cultivateur qui arrive difficilement à supporter la famille, elle se débrouille quotidiennement pour supporter les charges du ménage.

C’est une femme analphabète parce qu’elle n’a pas eu les moyens d’aller à l’école. A la fin de son apprentissage, compte tenu de sa situation difficile, elle se voit obliger de louer une machine à coudre afin d’exercer son métier.

Vu les difficultés qu’elle endure, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin de se doter des machines à coudre et aménager son atelier de couture pour exercer pleinement ses activités. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettrait d’améliorer ses conditions de vie socio économiques.

loans.use: buying a sewing machine and setting up a workshop

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz has sold agricultural produce in a  local market for about a year. He is from Khachmaz town, is married, and has two children. He is 57 years old.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more products.

loans.use: to increase agricultural produce

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in Gapé, Togo in 1970. His impoverished family had problems coming up with school fees for him, leading him to go to work at an early age farming. This is the main business activity in his region and Kokou works hard at it, though he has difficulty due to seasonal weather problems. He would like to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides in order to kill the weeds that cut into his harvest. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to buy these products and increase the land he has in cultivation as well as his production. Dynamic and honest, Kokou has already received one loan which he reimbursed without difficulty.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou est né à Gapé en 1970. Les difficultés de l’école dues à la pauvreté des parents l’ont poussées rapidement à s’adonner à l’agriculture. Activité première de la région, il l’exerce avec bravoure. Seulement il se voit confronter aux intempéries saisonnières. Ainsi, il pense s’acheter des engrais, des insecticides et herbicides pour tuer les mauvaises herbes qui rendent insuffisante la récolte. Pour y arriver, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour se doter des intrants agricoles afin d’augmenter sa surface cultivable et son rendement. Dynamique et honnête, il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident.

loans.use: buying agricultural chemical products such as fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit selling business

loans.name: Antiga

texts.en: Antiga (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children and lives with her family in Khachmaz town. Together with her husband, she has a small food store. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy more food items so she can attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more inventory for her shoe business

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
At 28 years of age, Mrs. Essi D. is her husband’s third wife and mother of three children. Generally, husbands who have several wives tend to neglect their role as fathers because they are weighted down by too much responsibility for supporting their households. It is thus the women who eke out a living for their children, feeding, clothing, and educating them. Such is the situation that Mrs. D. finds herself in.

Fortunately for her children, Essi is a dynamic woman with lots of business activities. Currently, she has opened up a little telephone stand, together with selling shoes and various other products. In order to expand these micro-businesses, Essi is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will serve her as business capital. This will allow her to increase her profit and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 28 ans, Madame D. Essi est la 3ème femme de son mari. Généralement, les hommes qui ont plusieurs femmes négligent leur rôle de père de famille car ils sont écrasés par les charges du ménage. Il revient alors aux femmes de se battre pour nourrir, habiller et scolariser leurs enfants. Telle est la situation dans laquelle se retrouve Madame D. Essi qui est aujourd’hui mère de trois (3) enfants.

Heureusement, elle est une femme très active et mène beaucoup d’activités. Actuellement, elle a ouvert une cabine téléphonique et y ajoute la vente des chaussures et autres produits divers. Pour améliorer cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses revenus et d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat et revente des chaussures et autres produits divers

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
At 53 years of age, Mrs. Yawa A. is a very dynamic woman. Married with four (4) children, she is familiar with several activities : the sale of gari (ground cassava), cereals, and other food products. This small business allows her to contribute much to her household expenses. Currently, these expenses have become very high because her husband, already worn out by old age, has become unemployed. In order to increase the size of her business, Mrs. Yawa A. is asking for $900 in financial support, which will serve as a capital base to buy and re-sell products. This will allow her to increase her revenue and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 53 ans, Madame A. Yawa est une femme très dynamique. Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle a plusieurs activités à savoir : la vente du gari et des céréales et autres produits vivriers.Ce petit commerce lui permet de contribuer pour beaucoup aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, ces charges sont devenues très lourdes car le mari déjà fatigué par l’âge est devenu inactif. En vue d’augmenter la taille de ses activités, Madame A. Yawa sollicite un apport financier de $900 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente de ses produits. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and re-sale cereals and other food products

loans.name: Améwotoéna

texts.fr:
At 53 years of age, Mrs. Améwotoéna A. is married to a polygamous man and has four (4) children. Very active, her principal activity is the fabrication and sale of cassava flour, called "gari." This is a very profitable business because her customers are primarily wholesalers. Being unable to grow cassava herself anymore, she is satisfied with buying fields' worth of cassava and making the most use of it. Currently, she is very limited by her means because the demand has grown very high. Thus, she wants to increase her production in order to suitably satisfy her clientele. She is therefore asking for a loan of $400 in order to make her purchases at lower cost and to realize higher profits.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 53 ans, Madame A. Améwotoéna est mariée à un homme polygame et est mère de quatre (4) enfants. Très active, son activité principale est la fabrication et la vente de la farine de manioc « gari ». C’est une activité très rentable car sa clientèle est la plupart grossiste. Ne pouvant plus cultiver elle-même le manioc, elle se contente d’acheter les champs de manioc et l’exploiter. Aujourd’hui, elle est très limitée par les moyens car la demande est devenue très forte. Elle désire donc augmenter sa production afin de pouvoir satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $400 afin de pouvoir faire les achats à moindre coût et réaliser de bon bénéfice.

loans.use: To buy cassava to make gari

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Widowed 5 years ago, Mrs. Yawa A. lives with her six (6) children. At 45 years of age, she is still very dynamic. Her principal activity is the sale of cereals and gari (cassava flour), a business which she combines with agriculture. The cereal business is very profitable, but requires considerable means, which Mrs. Yawa A. does not have at her disposal. She is thus asking for a loan of $850 which will serve as capital to increase her storage capacity. This will increase her income and also improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve depuis bientôt 5 ans, Madame A. Yawa vit avec ses six (6) enfants. A 45 ans, elle est encore très dynamique. Son activité principale est la vente des céréales et du gari (farine de manioc), activité qu’elle associe à l’agriculture. Le commerce des céréales est une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens. Ce dont Madame A. Yawa ne dispose pas. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $850 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage. Ceci améliorera son revenu et du coup les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and re-sell cereals

loans.name: Hanu

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hanu A. is 50 years of age. Despite her age, she remains very dynamic and knows how to manage her time. The second wife of a polygamous husband, she is the mother of five (5) children and has two (2) additional children in her care. Every morning, from 6AM to 9AM, she sells doughballs accompanied by fried fish. Afterwards, she goes to the market to sell cereals and gari (cassava flour). It is thanks to this activity that she is able to meet the needs of her children. Currently, the household expenses are becoming increasingly high, and Mrs. Hanu A. wants to enlarge her business. She is thus asking for a loan of $750 which will serve as a capital base for the sale, storage, and resale of cereals.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Hanu est âgée de 50 ans. Malgré cet âge, elle demeure très dynamique et sait gérer son temps. Deuxième femme d’un mari polygame, elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charges deux (2) autres enfants. Tous les matins, de 6 heures à 9 heures, elle vend des boules de pâtes accompagnées de poissons frits. Après elle se rend au marché pour la vente des céréales et du gari. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Aujourd’hui, les charges du ménage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes et Mme A. Hanu désire élargir son commerce. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des céréales.

loans.use: To buy, store, and re-sell cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her movie business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
At 45 years of age, Mr. Jean A. is married and has five (5) children and eight (8) additional people in his care. His principal work is the buying and selling of small ruminants. This business requires lots of travel because he needs to go to remote areas where these animals cost less. This necessitates considerable financial means. The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household. To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of $1000 which will serve to buy, transport, and re-sell small ruminants. This will allow him to meet effectively the needs of his household.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 45 ans Monsieur A. Jean est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charge huit (8) autres personnes. Il a comme activité principale l’achat et la revente de petits ruminants. Cette activité demande beaucoup de déplacement car il faut aller dans les localités reculées où ces petits ruminants coûtent moins chers. Cela nécessite assez de moyens financiers. L’activité est très rentable mais l’insuffisance de son capital rend le revenu insignifiant et les conditions de vie demeurent difficiles dans le ménage. Pour renforcer son commerce, il sollicite un appui financier de $1000 qui servira à l’achat, au transport et à la revente des petits ruminants. Cela lui permettra de faire face efficacement aux besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: To buy, transport, and re-sell small ruminants

loans.name: Babuu

texts.en: M. is a 28-year-old, up-coming business man and resident of Mbagala area, in Dar Es Salaam City. He had to leave school 7 years ago due to lack of school fees, and he has been in business ever since.  At his grocery, M. sells food stuffs including rice, wheat, maize flour, beans, cooking oil and other household needs. M.’s business slows down dry during the season, because the cost of food items shoots up and he isn't able to keep enough stock to supply his customers. M. is requesting a loan of $750  which will enable him to stock enough items to meet his customers' year-round demand and to build a store and expand his business.

loans.use: To build a store and insure supply of stock

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is a 39-year-old mother of four and a resident of Mbagala area, Dar Es Salaam’s largest slum area. She owns a boutique that specializes in ladies items (shoes, clothing, and hand bags). She has been in business for the past five years, and her business has been growing steadily since joining the Youth Self Employment foundation. She trades in Kariokoo, Dar es Salaam’s biggest trading areas, and her business booms during the Easter and Christmas seasons. She is requesting a loan of $550 to increase her stock so she can take more advantage of her boom periods and to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima, is a 42-year-old mother of 3 and a resident of Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam. She has two school-aged children, both in secondary school. Halima runs a grocery business strategically located in the Buguruni area. She and her husband (seated) have been doing business for the past twenty years. She is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation business trainings and this knowledge has helped her to improve her business. She has agents up country who supply her with food items, and she sells as retailer. She also sells pumped water at her home, which adds to her income. She is requesting a loan of $550, which will enable her to increase her stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand business

loans.name: Khalidi

texts.en: Khalidi is 28-year-old energetic carpenter and resident of Buguruni area. He is the father of 2 children. He has been in business for 6 years and is a skilled carpenter. Khalidi received business training from programs organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. He buys wood upcountry and sells some of it retail at his workshop. He uses the remaining wood to make chairs, beds and tables. He helps his community by employing three others to work with him. Khalidi is requesting a loan of $750 so he can purchase more modern equipment, which will enable him to expand his workshop and his business.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment and expand his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Merci

texts.fr:
A young woman of approximately 38, Mrs. Merci A. is the mother of one child and is also responsible for her sister’s three children.
