She is a woman with a great fighting spirit and her activity is the sale of poultry as well as small ruminants and snails. This enables her to meet the expenses of her household. The activity is demanding and requires a lot of input, particularly financial, which she has never had. Today she is requesting $600 in order to go herself into surrounding villages to obtain supplies at the least possible cost, thus increasing her income and improving the living conditions of her family.

Jeune femme de 38 ans environ, Madame A. Merci est mère d’un enfant et a à sa charge trois (3) autres enfants de sa sœurs. C’est une femme très battante et a comme activité la vente des volailles et aussi de petits ruminants et des escargots. Cela lui permet de supporter les charges de son ménage. L’activité a beaucoup d’exigence et demande assez de moyens surtout financiers; ce qui lui a toujours manqué. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite $600 pour aller elle-même dans les villages environnants pour s’approvisionner à moindre coût et ainsi augmenter ses revenus en vue d’une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy and sell poultry

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Aged 47, Mrs Akou A. is married and the mother of eight children. In addition to her own children, she is responsible for four others. Her husband, who has no steady employment, has five wives and about 20 children. He is totally irresponsible and shows almost no concern for the welfare of his children. As a consequence, Mrs. A. lives in extreme poverty and many of her children do not attend school. In order to survive, she generates income from growing cassava. The tuberous roots of cassava are turned into tapioca that she sells at the market. The quality of her product has given her today a large clientele, but she can no longer meet their demand because she does not have enough cassava. To address this situation, she would like to buy some cassava fields to use in her production. She is therefore requesting a business loan of $700 to buy cassava and produce and sell tapioca. This will bring change to her day-to-day life.

Agée de 47 ans, Madame A. Akou est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a à sa charge quatre (4) autres. Son mari qui n’a aucun emploi fixe a cinq femmes avec une vingtaine d’enfants. Il est totalement irresponsable et ne se soucie guère du bien-être des enfants. La conséquence est que Madame A. Akou vit dans une extrême pauvreté et nombre de ses enfants ne vont pas à l’école. Pour survivre, elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu la culture du champ de manioc. Les tubercules de manioc sont transformés en faine (gari) qu’elle vend sur le marché. La qualité de son produit fait qu’elle a à ce jour une clientèle abondante qu’elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire car elle n’a pas suffisamment de manioc. Pour améliorer cette situation, elle désire désormais acheter des champs de manioc pour sa production. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat de manioc, la fabrication et la vente du gari. Cela apportera un changement dans sa vie de tous les jours.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a cassava field for the production of tapioca

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

50 years old, Mrs A. Aku is a married, mother of five (5) children and has under her care three (3) other people. Her principal business activity is sale of paraffin oil in her locality. This activity gets enough incomes to her and allows her to contribute for a great part to the loads of the household.

Today, a very strong request for products of general food is felt and Mrs. A. Aku seized the occasion to also sell food in addition to oil sales. But she needs enough money to reinforce the activity. It is regularly in out-of-stock condition, and the customers are obliged to go elsewhere to make their purchases. To cure that and to satisfy her customers effectively, she requests a loan of $500 which will be used by her for the purchase and the sale of the products of general food.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Aku est mariée, mère de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Elle a comme activité principale la vente de pétrole lampant dans sa localité. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus et lui permet de contribuer pour une grande part aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, une demande très forte de produits d’alimentation générale se fait sentir et Mme A. Aku a saisi l’occasion pour associer ce petit commerce à sa vente de pétrole. Mais elle a besoin d’assez d’argent pour renforcer l’activité. Elle est régulièrement en rupture de stock, et les clients sont obligés de se rendre ailleurs pour faire leurs achats. Pour remédier à cela et satisfaire efficacement sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: Achat et  vente des produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
Mrs. Cécile A. is a 44 year-old widow and mother of eight children. She does some basic agricultural work but what brings her the income needed to meet the needs of her family is African pharmacopoeia. She is blessed with knowing the powers of many plants. Today this activity is going from strength to strength, but finding the herbs and plants poses serious problems. It means a lot of traveling from one prefecture to another, and from one region to another. Likewise, it requires a minimum cash flow in order to maximize purchasing power. For this, she is asking for a loan of $500.

. Madame A. Cécile est une veuve de 44 ans et mère de huit (8) enfants. Elle fait l’agriculture rudimentaire mais ce qui lui procure le revenu nécessaire pour assurer les besoins de sa famille est la pharmacopée africaine. Elle a la grâce de connaître la vertu de beaucoup de plante. Aujourd’hui cette activité prend de plus en plus de l’ampleur mais la recherche de ses herbes ou plantes pose de sérieux problèmes. Cela demande beaucoup de déplacement d’une préfecture à une autre, d’une région à une autre. De même, il faut un minimum de liquidité pour faire le maximum d’achat. Pour se faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $500.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying herbs and plants

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Aged 28, Mrs. Adjo A. is married and the mother of four children. Coming from a poor, polygamous family and wishing at all costs that her younger brothers and sisters will also be successful, she has taken responsibility for these five youngsters. Her income comes essentially from the sale of food products, especially fish. She is looking for funding to open a small grocery store. For this reason she is asking for financial support of $800.

Agée de 28 ans, Madame A. Adjo est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Sortie d’une famille pauvre et polygame et voulant à tout prix que ses petits frères et sœurs réussissent aussi, elle a pris à sa charge ces derniers au nombre de cinq (5). Ses sources de revenus proviennent essentiellement de la vente des produits vivriers et surtout du poisson. Elle cherche plus de moyen afin d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un appui financier de $800.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of food products

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
At 40, Mrs. Abla A. is unmarried and has three children. She also supports two orphans. Her main activity is the buying and selling of poultry in the markets around her village. This business brings in enough income to meet the daily requirements of her family. However, she is still very limited in her financial resources, especially as she has no one to help her. Mrs. A. is asking today for a loan of $500 to put into her business. In view of her earnings that always show a surplus and her dynamic attitude towards work, she is more than capable of making a profit on this loan and paying it back promptly.

A 40 ans, Madame A. Abla est célibataire avec trois (3) enfants. Elle supporte aussi deux (2) orphelins. Son activité principale est l’achat et la vente de volailles dans les marchés environnants de son village. Ce commerce lui rapporte assez de revenus nécessaires pour assurer le quotidien de sa famille. Cependant elle est très limitée en matière de ressources financières d’autant plus qu’elle n’a personne pour lui apporter des aides. Madame A. Abla sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $500 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Au vu de son compte d’exploitation toujours excédentaire et son dynamisme au travail, elle est bien capable de rentabiliser ce crédit et de le rembourser promptement.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling poultry

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 40, Mrs. Ablavi A. is married and the mother of five children. Her activity is to buy small ruminants and poultry from local breeders and sell them at the various markets. This work requires a lot of financial means since it involves a fair amount of travel. However, it is a very profitable activity. For this reason Mrs. A. is seeking financing to strengthen her business. She is asking for a business loan of $700. This loan is very important for improving her income as the financial burden of the family is too great.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame A. Ablavi est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son activité est d’acheter chez les éleveurs, des petits ruminants et des volailles qu’elle revend sur les marchés. Un travail qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers car demandant assez de déplacement. Cependant, c’est une activité très rentable. C’est pour cela que Madame A. Ablavi recherche un financement pour la renforcer. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $700 de fonds de commerce. Ce crédit est très important pour améliorer ses revenus car les charges de la famille sont trop lourdes.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling small ruminants and poultry

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 24, Mrs. Ablavi Z. is the mother of three children and lives with her husband in difficult conditions. Her husband is illiterate and has no trade to speak of. The children’s future is in jeopardy. But the bravery of this young woman gives the household much hope. Having obtained an initial loan of $300, she set up a small grocery business. Today, having repaid her loan, she is asking once again for help with the sum of $750, which she can put into the business. Supporting this family is also a humanitarian act for the children's future.

Agée de 24 ans, Madame Z. Ablavi est mère de trois (3) enfants et vit avec son mari dans des conditions difficiles. Le mari analphabète n’a aucun métier sous la main. L’avenir des enfants est presque compromis. Mais le courage de cette jeune femme donne beaucoup d’espoir au foyer. Avec un premier crédit de $300 qu’elle avait obtenu, elle a initié un petit commerce d’alimentation générale. Aujourd’hui, après avoir bien remboursé son crédit, elle sollicite de nouveau un appui d’un montant de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Soutenir cette famille est aussi une œuvre humanitaire pour l’avenir des enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling of general foodstuffs

loans.name: Vicky

texts.fr:
A young woman of 35, Mrs. Vicky A. is married and mother of three children. She sells groceries as a micro-business and primary source of income. This business is quite profitable but Vicky is often confronted with the problem of running out of certain items and she is not able to buy other things her customers need, both due to lack of business capital. In order to solve these problems and keep her clientele coming back, Vicky is asking for a loan of US$ 800. This will allow her to increase her profits and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Jeune femme de 35 ans, Madame A. Vicky est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Cette activité est assez rentable mais elle est souvent confrontée au problème de rupture de stock et il lui manque beaucoup d’articles que la clientèle exige. Afin de venir à bout de ces problèmes et de fidéliser ses clients, elle sollicite un financement de $800. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus en vue d’une meilleure condition de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: expanding the inventory of her little grocery store

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
At age 47, Mrs. Dovi Y. is married and mother of ten children. Most of her children are not in school because she lacks sufficient financial means to pay school fees, etc. Illiterate parents unfortunately often do not have high expectations for their children’s education.

Farming had always been Mrs. Y.’s principal source of income but nowadays, her impoverished soil has made crop production very poor and so suddenly, she finds herself with little income and living conditions for her family become worse and worse.

Mrs. Y., aware of this situation, has opened a little business selling rice, gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple), cooking oil, etc. This initiative has begun to improve her income to the point where she feels the need to apply for a loan of US$ 750 to expand her micro-business. The expansion of her business will allow her to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 47 ans, Madame Y. Dovi est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Presque tous ses enfants ne sont pas scolarisés faute de moyens financiers. Les parents analphabètes ne nourrissent aucune ambition pour leurs progénitures.

L’agriculture est l’activité principale de cette femme mais aujourd’hui, la pauvreté des sols fait que les rendements sont devenus très mauvais. Du coup, il n’y a plus de sources de revenus et les conditions de vie sont devenues pires qu’avant.

Madame Y. Dovi, consciente de la situation, a vite monté un petit commerce de riz, gari, de l’huile et autres. Cette initiative a commercé par améliorer son revenu d’où le désir de prendre un crédit de $750 afin de renforcer son commerce. Ce qui lui permettra d’envoyer ses enfants à l’école.

loans.use: expanding her little business selling Togolese staple foods

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla Z., 46, is married and mother of five children. She is also responsible for two other children. Her husband is illiterate and has become an alcoholic, so she has to support him as well.

Mrs. Z.’s source of income is selling cooked rice at school in her neighborhood. This is a very profitable business, but her capital is insufficient to allow her to expand and get the most from her micro-business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to build a shed. This sum will also allow her to keep a consistent supply of cooked food on hand. She will thus be able to increase her sales and the profit from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 46 ans, Madame Z. Abla est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a à sa charge deux (2) autres enfants. Son mari est un analphabète qui s’est donné à l’alcool. Il est à la charge de la pauvre femme.

Madame Z. Abla a pour activité la vente du riz préparé dans une école de son quartier. C’est un commerce très rentable mais ses moyens sont insuffisants pour l’agrandir et le rentabiliser. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour construire un hangar et faire un stock consistant de ses aliments. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.

loans.use: build a shed and have a consistent supply of cooked food on hand for resale

loans.name: Amé

texts.fr:
Abandoned by her husband some years ago, Mrs. Amé G. is around 50 years old. She has experienced hunger and much suffering in caring for her five children, but she has managed to earn a minimum income for her family thanks to rudimentary farming, selling gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple), and especially selling cooked gruel. At this point, she would like to set herself up to sell other staples along with the gruel. With that goal in mind, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which will allow her to get some basic shelving and stock and sell basic necessities. This will allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Abandonnée par son mari depuis plusieurs années, Madame G. Amé est âgée de 50 ans environ. Elle a connu la faim et la souffrance avec ses cinq (5) enfants. Elle arrive à faire survivre sa famille avec une agriculture rudimentaire, la vente du gari et surtout la vente de la bouillie qui lui procure le minimum tous les jours. Aujourd’hui, elle souhaite s’installer afin de vendre à part la bouillie les produits de première nécessité. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui lui servira à monter un petit étalage, à acheter et à vendre ses produits de première nécessité. Ceci améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buy basic shelving and some staple products for resale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old. He has a mobile phone shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop and develop his shop. He has three children, and all of them are in school. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard. He also wants to develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 22 years old and has a mini-market shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop, develop his shop and paint the shop. He has one child. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard. He also wants to develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop, develop his shop and paint the shop.

loans.name: Kofissi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kofissi G., 33, is mother of four children and has five other people for whom she is responsible. Her husband is without viable financial resources, so the whole burden of providing for the family rests with her.

A courageous and enterprising woman, Kofissi works hard every day to support her children. Her first two loans were reimbursed without problem. As micro-businesses, she raises farm animals and sells basic grocery products. Her great ambition is now to open a little grocery store. Since she has no capital for this micro-business, she is now asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to allow her to make her dream a reality.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 33 ans, Madame G. Kofissi est mère de quatre (4) enfants et a à sa charge cinq (5) autres personnes. Le mari étant sans emploi rémunérateur viable, toute les charges de la famille se repose sur la femme.

Femme courageuse et entreprenante, elle se bat au quotidien pour nourrir ses enfants. Ses deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés sans aucun incident. Elle fait de l’élevage et le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale. Aujourd’hui son ambition est grande : ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale. Faute de moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour la réalisation de ce projet.

loans.use: open a little grocery store selling basic necessities

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has a welding shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1000 to purchase a new welding machine. He has a big family, and he is the only one responsible for supporting them. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income. At the same time, he wants to hire two unemployed people to work with him.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 41 years old and has a carpentry shop in Kirkuk. He applied to get $1200 to purchase a new carpenter machine tiger type , . His shop was burn three months ago but he work and paint the shop and he look forward to rebuild his shop and increasing his assets . He wants to develop his shop and increase his income. At the same time, he wants to hire two unemployed to work with him .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new carpenter machine

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Widowed three years ago, Mrs. Yawa A. is 39 and mother of six children. She has a great deal of difficulty providing the basic necessities for her children, especially their school fees, etc. The older ones have had to leave school due to lack of financial means. Yawa’s business activity is selling the lengths of cloth used as wraps or sarongs in Africa (pagnes) and cosmetics. Unfortunately, she has very little capital to expand her business. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to increase her profit and be able to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Devenue veuve depuis 3 ans, Madame A. Yawa est âgée de 39 ans et mère de six (6) enfants. Elle a toutes les difficultés pour assumer les besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et surtout leur scolarité. Les aînés ont dû abandonner l’école faute de moyen. L’activité qui lui procure un peu de revenu est la vente de tissus pagnes et des produits de beauté. Malheureusement elle a des moyens très limités pour pouvoir agrandir ce commerce. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin d’améliorer ses revenus et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: sale of cloth (African sarongs) and cosmetics

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agossi V., 38 years of age and married to a polygamous husband, is mother of five children and responsible for six other people. In this family, every wife is responsible for the daily needs and the education of her children. Mrs. V. is dynamic and, in spite of very limited capital, manages to run a micro-business selling smoked fish. She is intent on improving her life with this business so that she can do better by those who depend on her as breadwinner. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 38 ans et mariée à un homme polygame, Madame V. Agossi est mère de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charge six (6) autres personnes. Dans cette famille, chaque femme s’occupe du quotidien et de la scolarité de son enfant. Madame V. très active et battante a comme activité la vente du poisson fumé avec un moyen très limité. Aujourd’hui, elle compte absolument améliorer ses conditions de vie à travers son activité génératrice de revenu. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $500.

loans.use: buying and smoking fish for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan owns his home on Alberto Ostria Street, # 1568, in the Tembladerani district of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and three children. He drives his taxi every afternoon and also runs a body shop from his home. He would use the loan for car maintenance and also to buy spare parts. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004; he opened his business with a loan from us and has noticeably bettered his station in life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Juan vive en casa propia en la Calle Alberto Ostria Nº 1568 de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; vive con su esposa y tiene tres hijos, trabaja con su taxi todas las tardes y también tiene su taller de chaperia ( body shop) el cual esta ubicado en el mismo domicilio. El crédito que solicita es para la reparación de su movilidad y compra de algunos repuestos. Es cliente antiguo de Impro desde el año 2004 y con nosotros comenzó su taller y mejoro notablemente su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Car maintenance

payments.comment: early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi B., 41, is mother of six children. Coming from a poor family, she is responsible for many relatives—lots of mouths to feed but few resources. Her business is stocking and reselling gari (i.e., manioc flour, a Togolese staple). This business is quite profitable and could be even more so if she were able to invest more capital into her micro-business. For this reason she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 so that she can stock a consistent amount of gari and thus increase her turnover and her profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 41 ans, Madame B. Afi est mère de six (6) enfants. Sortie d’une famille pauvre, elle a à sa charge beaucoup d’autres personnes de sa famille. Beaucoup de bouches à nourrir mais peu de ressources. Son activité est le stockage et la vente du gari. Ce commerce est bien rentable et peut l’être d’avantage si elle s’investit d’avantage. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite $800 pour faire un stockage consistant en vue d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.

loans.use: sale of gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple food)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa Z., 32, is mother of three children. Her principle business activity is selling basic foodstuffs and charcoal. This enterprise requires a big input of capital because supplies of charcoal must be bought far from the coastal area where she lives.

In order to make her business viable, Yawa has to be able to buy in bulk each time she goes to replenish her supply of charcoal. This of course necessitates a ready supply of cash. For this reason, Yawa is requesting a loan of US$ 800. She has always managed to repay prior loans in a timely fashion. This loan will be a supplementary resource that will allow her to get the most out of her micro-business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 32 ans, Madame Z. Yawa est mère de trois (3) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits vivriers et du charbon. Ce commerce demande beaucoup de fonds car les zones d’approvisionnement sont bien éloignées de la Région Maritime où elle habite.

Pour rentabiliser cette activité, il faut acheter beaucoup de produits lors d’un déplacement. Ceci exigerait la disponibilité de beaucoup d’argent. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite $800. Elle a toujours fait ses preuves en remboursant ses crédits antérieurs sans incident. Ce crédit sera pour elle une ressource supplémentaire afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce.

loans.use: buying charcoal in bulk far from the location of her business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos lives in his own house which is located on Final Landaeta Street, #45 in the Cota zone in the capital city of La Paz, Bolivia. He is single and works with plastic tubing for the sewer system. He distributes the material throughtout La Paz. The loan that he is applying for will be invested in increasing his capital. He was also asked to supply boxes of the same item for a customer. He has his workshop at home and works by himself.

He is a new client and his financial analysis indicates that he is able to access the loan for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Santos vive en casa propia en la Calle Final Landaeta Nº 45 de la zona de Cota huma de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y trabaja con tubos de plástico para el alcantarillado y reparte su material en La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar capital ya que le pidieron cajas para el mismo rubro. Tiene su taller en el mismo domicilio y trabaja solo.

Es cliente nuevo y el análisis financiero indica que puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs A. Edoh is a 55 years old woman and worn out by tiredness. In spite of her old age, it is very voluntary and full with creative idea. Its principal activity is the sales and manufacture of manioc and gari. Manioc is a starch made by leaching and drying the root of the cassava plant; the source of tapioca; a staple food in the tropics. Gari is pickled ginger.

This activity is of great benefit and allows her provide for the needs for the family. She wishes today to increase the business and requests for that a loan of $600 which will be used to her to buy provisions in manioc for the manufacture and the sale of the gari . This will enable her to provide the needs for her five (5) children and the four (4) others whom she provides for.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Madame A. Edoh est une femme âgée de 55 ans et usée par la fatigue. Malgré son âge avancé, elle est très volontaire et pleine d’idée créatrice. Son activité principale est l’achat des champs de manioc pour fabrication du gari. Cette activité lui procure de grands bénéfices et lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle désire aujourd’hui agrandir l’activité et sollicite pour cela un crédit de $600 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour s'approvosionner en manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente du gari. Ceci lui permettra de venir à bout des besoins de ses cinq (5) et des quatre (4) autres à sa charge.

loans.use: Achat en gros du manioc et fabrication du gari

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos lives in a house he has rented for over 12 years on Juan Granier Street in the September 14 district of La Paz. He is 62. He's a tailor specializing in men's suits. He employs two people who work alongside Carlos; one cuts out the patterns, and the other sews. He would use the loan to buy a sewing machine and a machine for sewing buttons and buttonholes, hoping to expand his business and hire another employee. He has been an IMPRO client since 2002. His record is good and qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Vaolunteer

Carlos vive en casa alquilada hace mas de 12 años en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 62 años de edad, es sastre y se dedica a la confección de ternos. Con el trabajan dos obreros, uno corta y el otro cose, por lo tanto genera empleo. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar sus activos comprando una maquina de coser y una maquina pega botones y poder emplear una persona mas. Por su antecedente histórico, es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002, se considera un buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy machinery for his tailoring shop

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth lives in her mother's house on Fernando Diez Street in the Alto San Pedro district of La Paz. She is 30. She works as a cleaner in offices and private homes. She has a two-year-old daughter and is separated from her husband. She would use the loan to make improvements to the room where she lives and make it more habitable. She is a new client and would draw from funds in our Development Program, Service Sector.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Janeth vive en casa de su madre en la calle Fernando Diez de medina de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 30 años de edad y trabaja como empleada de limpieza en oficinas y casas particulares; tiene una niña de 2 años y esta separada del esposo. El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar la habitación donde vive y hacerla mas habitable Es cliente nuevo y puede acceder a un crédito que estará dentro de nuestro programa de fomento, sector servicios.

loans.use: Household improvements

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Z., age 32, is a mother of three. Her main work involves commerce in staple foods and in charcoal. This business demands a good deal of funding because food-producing regions are located far from the Maritime Region where she lives. In order to make her business profitable, a lot of goods must be purchased on each trip. This would require access to a lot of money. This is why she is requesting $800. She has always proven herself by repaying her previous loans without incident. This loan will be an added resource for making her business worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 32 ans, Madame Z. Yawa est mère de trois (3) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits vivriers et du charbon. Ce commerce demande beaucoup de fonds car les zones d’approvisionnement sont bien éloignées de la Région Maritime où elle habite. Pour rentabiliser cette activité, il faut acheter beaucoup de produits lors d’un déplacement. Ceci exigerait la disponibilité de beaucoup d’argent. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite $800. Elle a toujours fait ses preuves en remboursant ses crédits antérieurs sans incident. Ce crédit sera pour elle une ressource supplémentaire afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce.

loans.use: Commerce in staple foods and in charcoal

loans.name: Chaïbou

texts.fr:
Born in Tsévié in 1977, Chaïbou I. left middle school due to a lack of financial support. He started selling kebobs, which produces a minimum of revenues. Married and the father of two, he struggles to provide for the needs of his family given his meager income. As an energetic man with a fine command of his business with regard to good hygiene, the practice of which attracts many customers, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy animals for making kebobs. He can then make his business worthwhile by maximizing his profit, in order to help more with improving his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1977 à Tsévié, Monsieur I. Chaïbou a arrêté ses études secondaires par manque de support financier et s’est lancé dans la vente de brochette qui lui procure de revenu minimum. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille difficilement par son maigre salaire. Dynamique et maîtrisant bien son activité par la pratique de l’hygiène qui attire beaucoup de clientèle. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui lui servira à l’achat des animaux pour la préparation des brochettes. Par ce crédit, il peut rentabiliser cette activité pour réaliser le maximum de profit afin de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy animals to make kebobs

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara makes footwear from leather, imitation leather, and other materials. She works for a shoe manufacturer that pays her for every dozen pairs of shoes she produces. Her home and her workshop are in Alto Tejar district of La Paz. She is a single mother and the sole support of her daughter. This is her first loan application. She would use the money to buy an industrial sewing machine and thus increase her productivity. She qualifies for the loan because of her experience in shoe manufacturing and her existing business, which generates enough income for her to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Clara recibe cuero, cuerina y todo tipo de material para calzado ya que se dedica a la preparación de calzados. Trabaja con una empresa de calzados donde le cancelan por la preparación de cada docena de calzados. Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una hija y es la única que mantiene a su familia ya que es madre soltera. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial para mejorar su producción Su trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la preparación de calzados, lo cual le da ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine on which to make shoes

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco has a car that he uses as a taxi cab for a company called VIP in the city of La Paz.

He lives in the area of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz. This is his second request for a loan from IMPRO. His credit history is impecable since he paid his first loan on time. He will use the loan to fix the engine, to purchase radio supplies and to do a general check-up on his car.

His credit and work history make him a great candidate for another loan, and he has experience running his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como radio taxi en la empresa VIP. De la ciudad de La Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la arreglo de motor, compra de radio de comunicación y un mantenimiento completo del vehiculo. Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: To fix taxi cab

loans.name: Migan Gérard

texts.fr:
Born in Notsè on December 20, 1980, Migan Gérard K. finished primary school before halting his studies to work as a miller. Today, as the owner of two mills, he is married and the father of two. A very energetic and honest man, he figured out how to manager his first loan, which he has repaid without a problem. He is again requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new mill. He believes he can increase his throughput and thus his income. He will then be able to do more to help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 20 décembre 1980 à Notsè, Monsieur K. Migan Gérard a cessé les études après le cours primaire et s’est lancé dans les activités de moulineur. Propriétaire de 2 moulins, il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Très dynamique et honnête, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit obtenu et l’a remboursé sans incident. De nouveau, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à l’achat de moulin neuf. Par ceci, il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi, contribuer d’avantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new mill

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr:
Born in Tsévié in about 1971, Madame Adakou K. finished primary school before ending her studies to start selling frozen fish and chicken. Married and the mother of two, she manages to help her husband with household expenses due to the revenue she brings in from her sales. An energetic and serious woman, she figured out how to manager two initial loans, which have been repaid without a problem. At present, she is requesting a loan of $850 to buy wholesale frozen chicken and fish, in order to strengthen her business. With this loan, she believes she will increase her income to better help with improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers 1971 à Tsévié, Madame K. Adakou a arrêté ses études après le cours primaire et s’est lancée dans la vente de poissons et de poulets congelés. Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle arrive à partager les charges du foyer avec son mari grâce aux revenus que lui procurent ses ventes. Dynamique et sérieuse, elle a su bien gérer ses deux premiers crédits qui ont été remboursés sans incident. A présent elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à l’achat en gros, de poulets congelés et de poissons pour renforcer son activité. Par ce crédit, elle pense augmenter ses revenus pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wholesale and sell frozen chickens and fish retail

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A., age 28, dropped out of middle school due to a lack of financial support and entered into an apprenticeship in tailoring. Unmarried and without any children, he takes care of his parents and two younger brothers as dependents. The income from his poorly equipped shop fails to cover household expenses. He is requesting a second loan of $850, now that he has paid back his first one. With this new loan, for acquiring sewing machines and fabric to make ready-to-wear clothing, he intends to do more to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 28 ans, Monsieur A. Kossi a cessé ses études au collège par manque de support financier et s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de couture. Célibataire sans enfant, il a à sa charge ses parents et deux petits frères. Les revenus de son atelier peu équipé n’arrivant pas à couvrir les dépenses faites dans son foyer. Il sollicite un second crédit de $850 après avoir bien remboursé le premier. Par ce nouveau crédit qui servira à l’achat des machines à coudre et des tissus pour la confection des habits prêt-à-porter, il pense contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric for making ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Mr. Edoh N. is 42 years old. He gave up his high school studies due to lack of financial means and launched himself into agriculture. Having become a farmer of renown by adding a poultry farm to his vegetable-growing business, he well-managed his initial loan which was repaid without difficulty. Versatile in his business, he solicits a new loan of $950 which will enlarge the area of his cultivated land and improve his chicken farm. With the current loan he means to benefit more areas of his business after raising his turnover, to best contribute to improving the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. Edoh est âgé de 42 ans. Il a arrêté ses études au cours secondaire par manque de moyens financiers et s’est lancé dans l’agriculture. Devenu un grand exploitant agricole de renommé par son bonne association d’élevage à la culture végétale, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Dynamique dans ses activités, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $950 qui servira à l’agrandissement de sa surface cultivée et améliorer son élevage de volailles. Par le présent crédit, il pense rentabiliser plus ses activités afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Expand his cultivated surface and improve his poultry farm

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Born in 1979 in Tsévié, Mr. Komlan A. gave up his studies in secondary school due to lack of means and launched himself in the sale of CDs, cassettes, and DVDs. Single and without children, he takes care of one little brother and his mother. Very skilled in the management of his business, he repaid his two first loans without default. Now he requests a new loan of $850 which will resupply his shop with new videos and DVDs. Through this he intends to boost his sales to best improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Komlan a arrêté ses études au niveau secondaire par manque de moyen et s’est lancé dans la vente des cassettes et de disque CD Vidéo. Célibataire sans enfant, il a à sa charge un petit frère et sa mère. Très doué dans la gestion de ses affaires, il a su bien rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans incident. A présent, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $850 qui servira à ravitailler sa boutique en nouveaux CD et cassettes vidéo. Par ceci il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling of CDs/cassettes/DVDs.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ami K. was born in 1977 in Tsévié, a territory of Zio. She is married and mother to four children. Her husband is a farmer in the town of Yoto and contributes rarely to the costs of the household. Mrs. K. runs a restaurant that she has managed for three years. Very enterprising, she is building her small business and delivers quality service to a client base which grows larger and larger. Honest and hardworking, she capably managed and promptly repaid the two previous loans she received. Today she seeks a loan of $850, which will allow her to buy grains to strengthen her sales of pasta and other foods. She will also be able to improve her revenues and sustain the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. Ami est née en 1977 à Tsévié (Préfecture du Zio). Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari est cultivateur dans la préfecture de Yoto et contribue rarement aux charges du ménage. Madame K. Ami gère un restaurant qu’elle tient depuis 3 ans. Très entreprenante, elle développe sa petite activité et rend un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus grande. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer et rembourser promptement les deux précédents crédits qu’elle avait obtenus. Elle sollicite ce jour un crédit de $850 qui lui servira à acheter des céréales en vue de renforcer ses activité de vente de boule de pâte et autres. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Buying grains to strengthen the sales of pasta and other foods at her restaurant.

loans.name: Albert Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Albert Kodjo D. is a young man of 25 years; very dynamic. His main business is farming, including raising local breeds of swine. He is married and the father of one child. Today, he hopes to improve his pork business and enhance productivity to ensure the schooling of his child, which is unfortunately well beyond his financial means. He asks to this effect a loan of $1000 which will let him redo his pens and maintain veterinary care and food supply for his animals.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Kodjo Albert est un jeune de 25 ans, très dynamique. Il a comme activité principale l’élevage de porc de race local et l’agriculture. Il est marié et père d’un (1) enfant. Aujourd’hui, il a le souci d’améliorer son activité en faisant l’élevage de porc de race améliorée afin d’accroître ses rendements et assurer la scolarité de son enfant. Malheureusement ceci demande beaucoup plus de moyen financier. Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1000 qui lui permettra de refaire la bergerie, d’assurer les soins vétérinaires et l’alimentation des bêtes.

loans.use: Improve the breeding and selling of pigs on his farm

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi A. was born in 1976 in Gapé, a territory of Zio. She resides in Tsévié where she runs her business selling root vegetables and coal. Married, she is the mother of three children who are left in her charge because her husband has just married another woman. She also cares for a niece who has lost her mother. Courageous and full of confidence, she has continued her business thanks to an initial loan she obtained for $500. This allowed her to free up much of her income for the basic needs of her children. Despite being illiterate, she manages her affairs extraordinarily well and is always on time in the repayment of her loans. She is a trustworthy woman who deserves support.

This loan of $850 that she requests will permit her to buy a very important stock of yams and wood coal. Thus, her sales will be increased and she can invest in the upbringing, health, and education of her children.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Amavi est née en 1976 à Gapé (Préfecture du Zio). Actuellement elle réside à Tsévié où elle fait son commerce de vente de tubercules et de charbon. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants qui sont laissés à sa charge car le mari vient d’épouser une autre femme. En plus, elle a en charge une nièce qui a perdu sa mère. Courageuse et pleine de confiance, elle a continué son activité grâce à un premier crédit de $500 qu’elle a obtenu. Ce qui lui a permis de dégager un revenu substantiel aux besoins élémentaires des enfants. Bien qu’analphabète, elle gère de façon extraordinaire son activité et est toujours très correct dans le remboursement de ses crédits. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue. Ce crédit de $850 qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire un stock plus important d’igname et de charbon de bois. Ainsi, son chiffre d’affaires pourra augmenter et elle pourra investir plus dans l’éducation, la santé et la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: Purchase, storage, and resale of yams and coal.

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr:
Mrs. Grace F. is a 40-year-old married women and mother of three (3) children. With a high school education and training in cooking, she launched into a private initiative. Today, she manages a little restaurant where she also offers pastries which make her successful. She is very much in demand with customers who have become very loyal.

Unfortunately, Grace hasn't got the necessary equipment to satisfy her customers' demands. For that reason, she is soliciting a US$ 1000 loan to help her buy the needed equipment for her restaurant. This loan will allow her to increase her sales and improve living conditions for Grace and her family.

Translated from French by Bijou Kuzimbu, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame F. Grâce est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Avec un niveau d’instruction du cours secondaire, et une formation en cuisine, elle s’est lancée dans une initiative privée. Elle tient aujourd’hui un restaurant où elle fait aussi de la pâtisserie qui lui réussit bien. Elle est très sollicitée par une clientèle devenue très fidèle.

Malheureusement, elle n’a pas l’équipement nécessaire pour répondre aux vœux de cette clientèle. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à acheter du matériel d’équipement pour son restaurant. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
Purchase of equipment for her restaurant
 (Achat de matériel d'équipement pour son restaurant)

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Eya A., 40 years old, is married and the mother of eight (8) children and is supporting five (5) other persons. All the household resposinbilities lie on her because her husband is often absent and totally neglects his role as a father. Her principal activity is the sale of vegetables and food products. In spite of her efforts, Mrs. Eya A.’s activities are not profitable because her household expenses are quite heavy. She is fighting so that her children can get out of the vicious circle of poverty. In order to expand the size of her business and increase her sales figures, Mrs. Eya A. is requesting a loan of $1000 that she will use as working capital.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame A. Eya est mariée est mère de huit (8) enfants et a à sa charge cinq (5) autres personnes. Toute la charge de la famille se repose sur elle car le mari est souvent absent et néglige totalement son rôle de père de famille. Son activité principale est la vente des légumes et des produits vivriers. Malgré ses efforts, Madame A. Eya n’arrive pas à fructifier ses activités car les charges du ménage sont assez lourdes. Elle se bat pour que tous ses enfants puissent réussir et sortir de ce cercle vicieux de la pauvreté. Afin d’augmenter la taille de son activité et accroître son chiffre d’affaire, Madame A. Eya sollicite un apport financier de $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of food products and vegetables

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr:
44 year old Mrs. Aïchatou D. is currently a secretary typist at the Prefectorial Administration for Social Affairs in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of a child who is in apprenticeship. With the present cost of living, her salary is no longer sufficient to cover the household expenses thus this project to sell notions and dry goods. A woman with a strong personality, she has been able to develop a clientele that totally trusts her. To fulfill the demands and multiple inquiries of her clientele she is soliciting a loan of $900 to buy notions- dry goods in order to strengthen her business. This will allow her to increase her income and de facto contribute to the improvement of her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame D. Aïchatou est actuellement secrétaire dactylographe à la Direction Préfectorale des Affaires Sociales à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui est actuellement en apprentissage. Avec le coût actuel de la vie, son salaire ne suffit plus pour faire face aux charges de la maison d’où ce projet de vente des articles de merceries et autres divers. Femme de caractère, elle a su développer une clientèle qui lui fait totalement confiance. Pour répondre aux exigences et aux nombreuses demandes de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $900 pour acheter les articles de mercerie en vue de renforcer son affaire. Ceci permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto contribuer à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et celle de la famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling of notions and dry goods

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa S. is a very active fifty-year-old woman. She is a married mother of eight (8) children who also takes care of three (3) other people. Her husband is often absent and leaves the responsibility for the household up to her. Her main business activity is market gardening, and she sells her produce herself at the market in order to meet her childrens' needs. In order to increase the size of her business, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy fertilizer and improve her land.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans, Madame S. Yawa est très active. C’est une femme mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants et a à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Le mari est toujours absent et laisse toutes les charges sur la femme. Elle a pour activité principale le maraîchage et c’est la vente de ces produits qu’elle vent elle-même au marché afin d’assumer les besoins de ses enfants. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des engrais et améliorer ses terres.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Afi Lucia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Lucia L. was born on March 22,1966, she does not have any children but is supporting three (3) nephews and a niece. For the last 15 years she has been doing small retailing and farming. With these activities she assumes as best one can the food needs of the children. Honest and dynamic, she has been able to manage her three previous loans. In order to increase her cultivable land, she is soliciting a financial help of $750 that will allow her to cultivate corn, manioc, okra and peanut. Part of it will be designated for the sale of peanuts, medicines and others. Thus she will be able to provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 22 Mars 1966, Madame L. Afi Lucia n’a pas d’enfants mais elle a en charge trois (3) neveux et une nièce. Elle fait depuis plus de 15 ans le petit commerce et l’agriculture. A partir de ces activités, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su gérer les trois précédents crédits obtenus. Afin d’étendre sa surface cultivable, elle sollicite un appui financier de $750 qui servira à faire la culture de maïs, de manioc, de gombo et d’arachide. Une partie va être destinée à la vente d’arachide, de médicaments et autres. Elle pourra ainsi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Cutivate corn, manioc, okra and peanut

loans.name: Komlan Kalépé

texts.fr:
Born in 1953 in Bolou-Dékpo (Préfecture du Zio), Mr. Komlan Kalépé A. is married and is financially responsible for eight (8) persons. His wife, a reseller, does not earn enough to be able to contribute to the household expenses. Mr. Komlan A. has been a carpenter for the last 34 years. Because of the quality of his work he has the confidence and respect of his clients. He manages his activity well and is very honest reimbursing his previous loans. In order to increase his business, he is soliciting a financial help of $950 to buy boards and logs for his work. With this loan his sales figures will be able to increase and he will be able to invest more in the education and health of his family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1953 à Bolou-Dékpo (Préfecture du Zio), Monsieur A. Komlan Kalépé est marié et a huit (8) personnes à sa charge. Son épouse, revendeuse ne gagne pas assez pour pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. Monsieur A. Komlan exerce comme activité la menuiserie il y a 34 ans. A cause de la qualité de son travail, il a la confiance et l’estime des clients. Il gère de façon correcte son activité et est très honnête dans le remboursement des crédits obtenus. En vue d’accroître ses activités, il sollicite un appui financier de $950 pour acheter des planches et grumes pour son travail. Avec ce crédit, son chiffre d’affaires pourra augmenter et il pourra investir plus dans l’éducation et la santé de la famille.

loans.use: To buy boards and logs for carpentry work

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mr A. Kossi was born in 1975 in Gati in the prefecture of Zio. After his primary studies, he obtained a car driving licence. Not having the means to buy a car, he completed 5 years of farming after that. Married and father of two children, his wife does not have any income generating activity -- with the result that all the needs are all supported by Mr A.. From his farming business, the family performs well -- it is responsible for the family's survival.

He is honest and rigorous, In order to have his own motor-driven pump, he requests a loan of $1000. He will be able to thus increase the farm's cultivable surface for an increase in its profits. This will be able to thus provide even more suitably for the needs of the family.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Monsieur A. Kossi est né en 1975 à Gati dans la préfecture du Zio. Après ses études primaires, il a fait la conduite auto sanctionnée par un permis de conduire. N’ayant pas les moyens pour s’acheter une voiture, il fait depuis plus de 5 ans le maraîchage. Marié et père de deux enfants, son épouse n’a aucune activité génératrice de revenu, ce qui fait que toutes les charges sont supportées par Monsieur A.. A partir de cette activité qu’il maîtrise si bien et à qui il doit sa survie, il assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Honnête et rigoureux, il a su gérer les deux crédits obtenus. Afin d’avoir sa propre motopompe, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Il pourra ainsi agrandir sa surface cultivable pour une augmentation de ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi subvenir convenablement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d'une motopompe pour le maraîchage

loans.name: Adrian Arnoldo

texts.es:
"I was given a home to live in but I've not been able to move into it yet because I need to make it secure for my family. I work the night shift and my wife has to stay alone with the children in the house. It is not a good area and there are lots of trouble makers. I am asking for $700 to make my house more secure."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

“Me dieron una casa de interes social pero no he podido habitarla ya que necesito ponerle antes las protecciones, más que nada por la seguridad de mi familia, yo trabajo en el turno de noche y mi esposa se quedaria sola con mis hijos y no quisiera que les fuera a pasar algo debido a que en ese fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes”.Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la colocación de protecciones en mi casa.

loans.use: Security for his house

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
"I urgently need to add another room to my home and install a floor because my family needs more space. My home is very small and only has 2 rooms: the living room, a bathroom and a kitchen. I am asking fo $1000 to build a room and lay a floor."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

“Me urge la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda y poner el piso ya que mi familia necesita más espacio, mi casa es muy pequeña y solo tiene 2 cuartos, la sala, un baño y la cocina”. Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto y poner el piso.

loans.use: To add a room and install linoleum.

loans.name: Martha Cleotilde

texts.es:
"I would like to put up security and a gate around my house since I live alone and feel unsafe at night. I'm seeking a loan of $600 to put up some security and a gate."

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

“Me gustaría poner protecciones y un portón alrededor de mi casa ya que yo vivo sola y me siento muy insegura en las noches. Solicito 600.00 dlls para poner protecciones y un portón en mi casa."

loans.use: To put up security in my home

loans.name: Christian De Jesus

texts.es:
"I have an internet cafe in my home and would like to invest in stationery and office supplies since my clients have asked me for them and I don't have any to sell. If I do, I think that my sales will increase and therefore, my income as well. I am seeking a loan of $1200 to buy more merchandise for my business."

Translated from Spanish from Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo un ciber en mi casa y me gustaría invertir en la compra de material escolar y de oficina, ya que mis clientes me lo han solicitado y no tengo nada de eso en venta, pienso que mis ventas aumentarían mucho y por lo tanto mis ingresos también. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar mercancía para mi negocio."

loans.use: to invest in my business

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José Daniel is married and has two small children who are 6 and 7 years old. Previously, he used to work for a gas company, but four years ago on his son's birthday, José wanted to rent a children's show for his party but could not find any that he liked. He bought some costumes of different characters and a sound device and put on the show himself. Afterwards, he started to offer his services with the help of his nephews and his wife, who made the costumes. Little by little, he accumulated and bought everything he needed for making spectacular shows.

These days, José is seeking a loan of $375, which will be used to buy more material to make more costumes and thus, create new personae that children like. He promises to repay this loan in 4 months. Be an important part of developing this unique business. Make the decision to support José. He and his family sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

José Daniel es casado y tiene dos pequeños de 6 y 7 años de edad. Anteriormente él trabajaba en una compañía de gas, pero hace cuatro años en el cumpleaños de su hijo, José quería rentar un show infantil para su fiesta pero no encontró alguno de su agrado, fue así como adquirió disfraces de algunos personajes, un aparato de sonido, y él mismo hizo el show. Después empezó a ofrecer sus servicios con ayuda de sus sobrinos y de su esposa que elabora los disfraces, poco a poco fue adquiriendo todo lo necesario para hacer más atractivos sus espectáculos.

En estos momentos José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de material que necesita para elaborar más disfraces y tener los personajes nuevos que son del agrado de los niños, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio especial, decídete a apoyar a José, él y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy material to make costumes and disguises

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana has been selling clothing for 12 years. She began her business when she was confronted with the need for an extra income in order to improve her family’s standard of living. She is married and has three children, who are 10, 13, and 16 years old. In the beginning, one of her sisters obtained clothing for her, but eventually she went to Moroleón, en Guanajuato, to get it for herself. She has now incorporated the making and selling of school uniforms. Due to the favorable payment plan she offers, she has had a lot of demand and supplies two schools in the town of Linares, Nuevo León.

In order to cover the orders she has for this new school year, Juana needs a loan of $925.00. She will use it to buy the fabric she needs to make the school uniforms. She will return the loan in 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business. You can help this family, thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 10, 13 y 16 años de edad. Al principio una de sus hermanas le conseguía la ropa pero después ella misma fue a adquirirla a Moroleón, en Guanajuato. Ahora ha incorporado la elaboración y venta de uniformes escolares, gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofrece ha tenido mucha demanda y surte a dos escuelas de la localidad de Linares, Nuevo León.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene para este nuevo ciclo escolar, Juana necesita un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la compra del material que necesita para la elaboración de los uniformes escolares, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, tu puedes ayudar a esta familia, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making school uniforms

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es:
José de Jesús is from the town of Linares, Nuevo León. He is married and has six children, all between the ages of 1 and 12 years old. His mother liked to raise quail and she came to have as many as 40 of them. People began to ask her for eggs and the birds themselves, so she decided to formalize her business. Soon after, she asked José to run it for her. With the help of his wife and his two oldest sons, he has been able to make the business successful. He now has Japanese quail and demand is high. He has also started making and selling jam, which has brought in many clients due to the good quality of the product.

So that he might continue growing his business, José is requesting a loan of $375.00. He will use it to buy labels and jars to improve the appearance of the products he sells. He will return the loan in a period of 6 months. Be a part of this business and decide to help this family. They are very thankful for the support you are able to give them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

José de Jesús es originario de la localidad de Linares, Nuevo León, está casado y tiene seis hijos entre 1 y 12 años de edad. A su madre le gustaba criar codornices y llego a tener hasta 40, después comenzaron a solicitarle huevos y aves, así que decidió formalizar su negocio y al poco tiempo le pidió a José que se hiciera cargo, con la ayuda de su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores él ha logrado sacar adelante este negocio, ahora tiene un criadero de codorniz japonesa con una alta demanda. También ha iniciado con la elaboración y venta de conserva, donde gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha logrado ganar muchos clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de etiquetas y envases para mejorar la imagen de los productos que comercializa, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este negocio y decídete a ayudar a esta familia ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve the appearance of his products

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José Alberto is a young entrepreneur, who started his own business sixteen years ago, offering his services as a hair stylist. He has always liked this craft and, as a means to grow, having his own beauty salon has become his dream. He started with just a mirror, a pair of scissors and a machine but, thanks to the good quality of his services, his clientele has multiplied and his business has grown, while he has been able to specialize in this type of services.

In order to offer an improved service in a better and more ample locale, Alberto is requesting a $925 loan, which he’ll invest in the renovation of his salon. He hopes to increase his capacity to serve clients and to continue growing, as he has done so far. You can be part of Alberto’s accomplishments and he is sincerely thankful for the help you are providing him.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

José Alberto es un joven emprendedor, quien desde hace 16 años inició su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista. Este oficio siempre ha sido de su agrado y para superarse se convirtió en un sueño para él tener su propia estética. Comenzó sólo con un espejo, unas tijeras y una máquina, pero gracias a la buena calidad de su servicio, pronto sus clientes se multiplicaron y fue creciendo su negocio y especializándose en este tipo de servicios.

Para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y tener un lugar más amplio y mejor, Alberto está solicitando un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local. Con esto espera aumentar la capacidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Tú puedes formar parte de los logros de Alberto y él agradece sinceramente la ayuda que le brindas.

loans.use: Renovation

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona is divorced and has six children. The alimony that she receives from her ex-husband as very low and didn't meet her family's expenses, so she started selling tacos and hamburgers fiver years ago. The desire to get ahead and for her children to finish their studies has motivated her to work hard, and fortunately, she has been able to get a very central location where her business has grown with the help of her children.

At this time, Ramona is requesting a loan of $475 which she will use to purchase materials to increase her production and be able to meet her customer demand. She is committed to returning this amount in 6 months. The family's well-being is in your hands. Make the decision to help help them.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Ramona es divorciada y tiene seis hijos, la pensión que recibe D. su ex esposo era muy baja para cubrir los gastos D. su familia por lo que comenzó a vender tacos y hamburguesas hace cinco años, el deseo D. salir adelante y que sus hijos culminaran sus estudios la han motivado a esforzarse mucho en su trabajo, afortunadamente logró conseguir un local en un lugar céntrico donD. ha hecho crecer su negocio con ayuda D. sus hijos.

En estos momentos, Ramona está solicitando un préstamo D. $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra D. insumos para incrementar su producción y poder cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar D. esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Kneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kneang N. is 39 years old and the mother of one school-going child. To service her family’s living expenses, she rents rooms to the people in her area, which earns her around $7 each day. Her husband (pictured here because Kneang N. is not available) is a motor-taxi driver, earning on average $3/day in revenue.

Mrs Kneang N. hopes to used this $1,000 loan to open a shop selling soft drinks and some kind of grocery products to earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and save enough money for her child’s education.

loans.use: To open  a shop selling soft drinks and grocery items

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Kneang Ny has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Drame

texts.en: Dramé M. is a dynamic 40 year old tradesman. He lives in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of Abidjan District. M. owns a well managed store and sells fresh milk, sweets, candies, juices, soaps, sugar, etc. M. is married and has 4 children. He wants to expand his activities and diversify his product range by selling rice. He will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk from the largest wholesaler in order to get lower prices and improve his profit margin. He joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in 2005 when he heard about the organisation from one of his friends. M. has performed very well since then and is honest and well organized.

loans.use: Dramé Mamadou will use the loan to expand his product range

loans.name: Almagul

texts.en: Almagul is a mother of 2 children. She is 46 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Almagul has 2 years of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Ngoran Eugenie

texts.en: K. Ngoran Eugenie is a dynamic and ambitious 40 year old woman. She lives with her partner who works as a driver for a public transportation company. Eugenie sells a variety of fresh legumes and vegetables in Port-Bouët, one of the very populated suburbs in the south of Abidjan District. She has been in business for a number of years and has an 11 year old boy who will start grammar school in September 2007. Eugenie is one of the key contributors towards generating income for her extended family and helps to pay for the school fees and tuition of other children in the family. Eugenie joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in February 2005.

loans.use: Konan Ngoran Eugenie will use the loan to purchase goods from the fields

loans.name: Ndri Yolande

texts.en: Djé Ndri Yolande is a dynamic 44 year old woman. She is married and lives with her family in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of Abidjan District. She has 3 children. The 2 elder daughters are in secondary school and the younger boy is in primary school. She believes that her children are her future and invests a lot in their education. Yolande has sold utensils at Port-Bouët market for many years and joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in 2005. She wants to expand her business and diversify her product range by selling high quality steel utensils which will provide her with a better return.

loans.use: Djé Ndri Yolande will use the loan to diversify her products offer

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.en: A. Lucienne has been selling ladies fashion at Port-Bouët market since 1982. She is a 55 year old widow with 3 daughters and 2 sons. She works with one of her 3 daughters and spends most of her time at the market taking care of her store. She joined the AE&I Microcredit Program two years ago and has performed well so far. Her business is the sole revenue resource from which she is paying her youngest son's university tuition and fees. She is honest and rigorous in the management of her business.

loans.use: Adoni Lucienne will use the loan to purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Minayat

texts.en: Minayat has been in this business for one year. He and his family live in the town of Khachmaz.  He is a 46-year-old man with 4 children. Minayat uses this car to distribute goods to stores. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy spare parts to service this car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Gulara

texts.en: Gulara has her own orchard where she grows fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 4 years. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Ashagi -Zeyid. Now Gulara needs a loan of $825 to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Kouadio

texts.en: Kouadio A. Christine is a single mother.  she is 37 and lives with her 2 children in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She sells cooked cassava in the Port-Bouët open market and has a lot of customers among the tradeswomen in the market who take their lunch near their businesses. She has 11 years of work experience in this business and is very dynamic. She is very happy as it’s her second consecutive year she gets a loan from AE&I for the payment of the school fees and tuitions for her children. Christine children who are both in secondary school will resume school in September 2007 and she will use the loan to pay for their education.

loans.use: Kouadio Amenan will use the loan to pay school fees and tuition for her 2 children

loans.name: Chichak

texts.en: Chichak (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Two years ago she started this business. She needs a loan of $775 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for improving her orchard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en: Suraya is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Ashagi-Zeyid. This 46-year-old has one year of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of $825 to purchase a cow. She wants to increase the number of cows and get  more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Koua

texts.en: Koua B. G. is 39 years old single man. He lives in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District with his 2 children, who are in primary school. He sells clothes accessories and has more than 15 years of work experience in this business from which he care to the education expenses of his children. G. is dynamic and ambitious.
