He joined AE&I microcredit program in March 2004 and has been a good performer since then. He wants to purchase clothes accessories stock of products for primary school dress that has been ordered from him by a group of tailors.

loans.use: Kouao Bile Guillaume will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: This single man is 26 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Alekseyevka.  Elnur is enjoying his business and has a lot of clients. Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy cloth to meet all the demands of his clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Lasme Lou

texts.en: Lasme Lou M. is a dynamic 41 years old single woman. She has 3 children and lives in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She sells various products such as charcoal, yam, palm oil on the market of Port-Bouët, M. who take care to the education expenses of her children alone is seeking for a loan to ensure the payment of school fees and tuitions in September 2007 for her 3 children. She joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has been a good performer so far. She is very exited to get a loan from people she doesn’t know but who think about her life.

loans.use: Lasme Lou Madeleine will use the loan to pay school expenses for her 3 children

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en: Sudaba is 40 years old, and has been in this business for one year. She is a mother of 2 children, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. This young mother  would now like to apply for a loan of $825 to buy goods for her general store and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Allani

texts.en: Allani N. is 36 years old dynamic woman. She is married to a mechanic welder and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. Allani is a good tailor and clothes accessories seller on the Port-Bouët’s market. She has more than 12 years work experience. She consistently contributes to her family revenues generation. N. has got an important order of school dresses to be delivered for a primary school. N. who joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 has been a good performer. She has always reimbursed her loans in good manner

loans.use: Allani Nzi will use the loan to purchase school dress accessories.

loans.name: Tra

texts.en: Mrs Tra L. T. is experienced in selling food products. She is 43 and is living in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She started selling on Marcory’s open market since the very beginning of its opening in 1987. Divorced, she lives with her 8 children at their apartment. Ground nuts, corn, apples, salt, ginger, fish powder and rice are usual products she sold to customers. She needs a loan to extend her activity in order to increase revenues and care to her children education expenses. She is an honest woman who has always reimbursed her loans in good manners since she joined AE&I microcredit program in May 2005.

loans.use: Tra Lou Toe will use the loan to pay education expenses

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea S. is a 43-year-old father of 3 school-going children. He and his wife live with their children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works as a soldier, earning around $2 each day.

His wife generally makes around $8/day in revenue from renting rooms in their house and selling a variety of grocery products to the local community.

Mr Chea S. is requesting a $300 loan for his wife. The loan will be used to expand her inventory by buying more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet his wife's clients' needs.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
A 50-year-old widow with 2 children, Mrs. Sin H. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To meet her family’s daily needs, and especially her children’s education, Mrs. Sin H. rents different rooms of her house to the people in her area, earning around $5 each day.

Recently, Mrs. Sin H. has applied for a loan which helps her to repair and build more rooms in order to fulfill her tenants’ needs. She is confident that she will expand her rental business and provide a good quality of life for her family one day.

loans.use: To repair and build her rental rooms to accommodate more tenants.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sin Heang has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Dehi

texts.en:
Mrs Dehi M. lives with her family in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She is 46 years old and is married. M. is mother of 4 children. Now that her husband is retired from “Air Afrique” Airlines Company, she is the one who works all day long to support her children. Every New Year she makes sure they have clothes, food, shoes and their education paid, also. She struggles everyday to bring back those simple times of yesterday. Her husband income is not enough to cover all their little family charges, because of some nephews he has in charge indeed.
It’s the 2nd time, she is given opportunity to request AE&I a loan. She will use  his loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses.

loans.use: Dehi Martine will use the loan to pay education expenses and purchase goods

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
A 41-year-old widow with 5 children, Mrs. Phen N. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 
To supplement her family income, she rents different rooms of her house to the people in her community, earning around $5 each day. Four of her children work for a private company, and their salaries also help to pay for some of the household expenses. Mrs N. is seeking a $600 loan to be used to build more rooms so that she can generate additional profits from her room rental business.

loans.use: To build more rooms to accommodate more tenants.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama M., is a single mother, born in1968 in the north side of Cote D’ivoire.5 years of work experience, she is a very dynamic mother having in charge 2 children going to primary school and her taxi driver of husband, whose income is not enough to cover home charges. Her children are very excellent at school, and her husband is very proud of them meanwhile, they are facing a plenty of problems since kids grew up. The elder is 15 years old and the 2nd, 10. So as to overcome any bad situation and keep the balance of their children school performances, they have decided together, to join AE&I microcredit program in order to purchase a large quantity of food products and make advertising to attract more customers and improve their revenue.

loans.use: Adama Mawa will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Hoyi

texts.en: Hoyi Hélène is 35 years old and has decided to live with her husband for better and worst on September15th,  2000. They have 3 children, 2 among them are freshman and sophomore in law and electricity, and the youngest is in secondary school. She has 7 years of work experience in selling food products. Hélène lives with her family in Marcory, in the south of the Abidjan District. She has demonstrated dynamism and honesty since she joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005. She is a good performer and she is requesting this loan to pay school expenses for her children. She thanks in advance those world citizens who believes in her and help her to take care to her family.

loans.use: Hoyi Hélène will use the loan to pay education expenses

loans.name: Azoble

texts.en: Azoblé E. is a very dynamic single mother. E. is 41 years old. With the first credit she was given, she opened a store of cosmetics products and another various sales business which thrives well. She lives with her 2 children in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She has long experience in micro business. E. takes care to her children life and education expenses from revenues generated from her activities. E. heard about AE&I in June 2005 and benefited her first loan 3 months later. She has performed very well since then.

loans.use: Azoblé Emilienne will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Blesson

texts.en: Blessou A. is 37 years old lady and part of new uprising generation. She has started bananas, yams, and cabbages sale on Marcory’s market 6 years ago. She learnt with her aunt to take the very first steps in the world of trade. Today she is very happy of the long way she went through to perfect her trade capabilities .A. is not married yet, but lives with a man who works as an office clerk in a local Bank. They planned together to get married very soon and open a restaurant. She needs a loan to pay school fees for their young son who is in primary school. A. has been performing well since she joined AE&I microcredit program since November 2004.

loans.use: Blessou Angeline will use the loan to pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Lohore

texts.en: Lohoure O. is a 49 years old widowed woman. She lives in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. Lohoure sells pig meat on marcory’s market. She has among 7 children. The 2 younger sons are in secondary school. They all have, good reports, and their mother is very proud of them. She pays schools fees from her micro business revenues. She has benefited several loans from AE&I since November 2004 and has always performed very well. She requesting the present loan to buy cattle of pig in order to improve margin and increase her profits.

loans.use: Lohoure Odio will use the loan to purchase pigs for meat sales

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va S. N. is 48 years old and married with 6 children: one is married and 4 of the others are employed at a garment factory. Her husband is employed at the government-owned water processing plant, earning $5 a day.

In Cambodia, not all houses have access to running water from official government pipes. To receive water in this way people must pay for the cost of installing an official pipe, which is more than many people can afford. Mrs. Va S. N. would like to borrow $1,000 so that she can supply water to all her neighbors for a small profit. Once the pipe up and running, she expects to earn about $3 a day from this.

loans.use: To purchase a pipe with which to sell water from her house to her neighbours.

loans.name: Umarat

texts.en: Umarat is a mother of one child. She is 57 years old, a widow, and she lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has been in this business for 6 years. She sells chairs to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy more chairs and tables.

loans.use: To buy chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of stationery stock

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Poshpohodjaeva Rahima is an accountant. She is retired now. She is married and has 4 children. Her elder son has several shops of alcoholic drinks, and Rahima helps her son as a salesperson. She became a salesperson in 2005, and she likes her job. Her son buys drinks from the factories every week. She sells them at her trade place. In the wedding time from June to September, Rahima says that they make a good profit. Their shops are situated in the big bus station, and that’s why they have many clients every day. In the future she wants to increase the number of her goods; for this purpose, she is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Four years ago this young man started this business. He is 33, married, and has four children. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Muzaffar-Oba. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve his farm and then he will be able to meet all demands of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
54-year-old Elshad A. lives with his family including four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Qubadli region. He is the only breadwinner for his family. His family’s living conditions are not good enough. The family income is rather limited. Elshad began his business 6 years ago. Because he did not have enough financial resources, he couldn’t develop his business well enough in the beginning.

With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs. After awhile he made important steps in his business and increased the area of his trading.

Now, he wants to borrow $400 in order to further develop his business, to build a store and to buy digital scales. He will improve his family’s living conditions with this additional income and obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: To build store and to buy digital scales

loans.name: Sekibuule

texts.en:
Sekibuule H. is a married man with four children: 3 boys and 1 girl. The children are all currently enrolled in school with the eldest (girl) in senior high, and the others in junior high, Fifth Grade and First Grade.

In 2002, H. bought a small taxi vehicle and operated a special hire business for 3 years. He then sold the taxi and used the proceeds to buy a small plot of land and build a house for his family. Since then, H. has been employed as a special hire taxi driver, which does not earn as much as his previous employment when he actually owned the vechicle he drove.

H. would like to secure another car to enable him to make sufficient money to support his family. He has already registered with Wandegeya Tour and Traveling Association, an umbrella organization for the special hire taxi drivers.

He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva and $1,181 from Share An Opportunity Micro finance, making a total of $ 2381 (four million Uganda Shillings 4,000,000) payable in 8 months. This loan will help H. become a self reliant person who is also able to meet all his family's living expenses.

loans.use: Puchase of a small taxi vehicle

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan has 10 years of experience in this business. He is from the town of Khachmaz. This 44-year-old man is married and has 3 children. He sells agricultural produce in the market and supports his family. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more agricultural produce and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce
